title: andrea_doria_(warship_girls_r)
body:
[i][[Warship Girls R]][/i]'s personification of the Italian battleship [i]Andrea Doria[/i]. Character designed by [[Jianren]]. 

h4. Appearance
She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]] styled into [[twintails]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her outfit consists of set of black [[ribbon]]s with red and white dice, a [[choker]], a shoulder-less white and red top exposing her [[midriff]], [[bandaid]], a pair of brown [[gloves]], a blue [[skirt]] held in place with a leather [[belt]], [[striped legwear|striped]] [[thighhighs]] and a pair of light blue see through [[anklet]]s.

Her machinery is based on the dreadnought configuration of five [[ship turret|turret]]s of varying numbers of 12-inch [[cannon]] with her arm mounted turret representing her amidships armament.

She received a remodel (post #2019755) in patch 1.3.3 based on her historical reconstruction to a more modern battleship. This version of her is still quite physically similar to her former self, sporting a new [[sailor collar]] as part of her upper outfit, an anchor [[brooch]], the removal of her arm mounted turret, a pair of light blue see through [[bangle]]s and another two similar pieces of jewelry adorning her twin tails representing the installation of a "Pugliese Torpedo Defense System":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Littorio-class_battleship#Pugliese_torpedo_defense_system].

As part of the "Children's Day 2016":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Children%27s_Day] update an [[official alternate costume]] (post #2399989) was made available featuring a [[aged down]] version of Andrea in a [[shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], clutching a [[book]], larger hair ribbons and a bandaid in the location where her amidships turret used to be.

h4. Personality
Andrea is a thoroughbred [[tsundere]], initially disappointed with the player on acquisition, only really opening up with her remodeled version. Due to her similarities of both personalities and looks with [[Akizuki Airi]] she earned the nicknames "Airi" and "Daughter" among players and memed so hard among the community it effected the reveal and design of her sister ship [[caio duilio (warship girls r)|Caio Duilio]].

h4. See also
* [[Andrea Doria (Azur Lane)]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: [i]Andrea Doria[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_battleship_Andrea_Doria]
other_names: アンドレア・ドーリア

title: hood_(warship_girls_r)
body:
[[Warship Girls R]] character.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with a small [[ahoge]] and a vibrant pink flower shaped [[hair ornament]]. She also wears a pair of [[red-framed eyewear|red]] [[semi-rimless eyewear|semi-rimless]] [[glasses]]. Her outfit consists of a military themed officer's outfit in black with white cuffs, a white [[capelet]] all with gold trim, prominent [[aiguillette]], a blue [[plaid skirt]] and white [[thighhighs]].

Her machinery is equally split between both sides of her, mounting two superfiring [[ship turret|turret]]s of twin 15-inch [[cannon]] to her left and right representing her forward and stern main armament configuration. Her ship funnels and a mast flying the [[white ensign]] are mounted behind her.

On August 29th, Hood's remodeled artwork (post #2401044) was revealed as part of the Project R trailer and her remodel was released with patch 2.0 in early November. This version of Hood's hair ornament changes color to purple, her military uniform's base colors change to white with blue cuffs and capelet. Her footwear now features a blue cross shaped pattern with a [[union jack]] on her right leg. 

The machinery is also updated to include two red and white armor plates mounted forward to protect her legs and thighs, the addition of a pair of twin 4-inch turrets and a pair of British 2 Pounder 8 Barrel "Pom-Pom" anti-air guns mounted to her rear. The mast is replaced with the ship's spotting top featuring type 284 gunnery radar.

Hood is depicted as a well-spoken, serene woman, exemplifying true British values such as sipping tea, staying calm and carrying on. Her bad eyesight is accredited to HMS Hood's inability to discern the difference between Prinz Eugene and Bismarck during the opening phases of the Battle of Denmark Strait. She may be suffering a degree of breast envy, padding out her chest area with one of the ship's cats, Fishcakes.

A bug with her remodel's [[chibi]] battle sprite where she would be stuck in a permanent [[@_@]] state after taking damage of any kind has associated her with the facial expression.

She is regularly paired with [[bismarck (warship girls r)|Bismarck]] either as bitter rivals, in some form of [[Yuri]] situation or both at the same time. She may also be seen as the leader of other Royal Navy characters due to her remodel's skill requiring that she be made flagship of any formation to take effect.

She is based on the British Royal Navy's "HMS Hood":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMS_Hood], an Admiral-Class warship named after "Admiral Samuel Hood":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samuel_Hood,_1st_Viscount_Hood]. Her ship index number is 1.

Her original artist was [[JS Sang]] but with her remodel her art was replaced with [[15k]].

h4. See also

* [[Hood (Azur Lane)]]

title: rodney_(warship_girls_r)
body:
[[Warship Girls R]] character.

Rodney has [[blonde hair|blonde]] low-tied hair with the tail end resting on or just [[hair over shoulder|over her right shoulder]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her outfit is a late 18th/early 19th century inspired [[military uniform|Royal Navy officer's uniform]] made of up of a black [[bicorne]] [[hat]] with golden trim, an embroidered blue coat with red facings, cuffs, collar, golden [[epaulettes]], [[aiguillette]], a pair of white [[gloves]], a red [[sash]] worn around the waist, a white [[skirt]] and white [[thighhighs|thighigh]] boots.

A large portion of her machinery is located on her right side with all three of her triple 16-inch gun [[ship turret|turrets]] representing the design of the Nelson-class where all main armaments were located forward of the super structure. On her left a large curved shield in the shape of a ship's stern is used as protection. There are several additional turrets of double 6-inch guns located on the inner ring of the machinery as a secondary armament with a mast and crane in the back. 

Rodney received a remodel early in the game's life. This version of Rodney sees her entire outfit swap colors with red replacing blue and blue replacing red. The plumage on her bicorne increases with new white plumage mixed into the fray. There's an additional white sash draping down from her left shoulder with golden trim added to almost all pieces of clothing. White [[garter straps]] are also made visible.

The machinery is augmented with a green and blue camouflage paint scheme. The main turrets and the rear section of the machinery mounts multiple single 20mm Oerlikon cannons and a single 2 Pounder 8 Barrel "Pom-Pom" anti-air gun. On one turret a Supermarine Walrus rests on a seaplane catapult. The inner ring of equipment is removed with three of the four 6-inch turrets now located on the more ship like designed stern, better representing how these secondary batteries were positioned. The mast has also been replaced with a smokestack and the ship's conning tower with various gunnery and aircraft detecting radar.

On Children's Day 2015 a child version of unmodified Rodney was awarded as a quest reward, with lighter colored machinery covered in crayon graffiti. 

A kind individual concerned with the success of her sister and a lover of a nice Atlantic Sea breeze. A combination of her pleasant remodel art and her powerful armor piercing BIG SEVEN special attacks have made her one of the most ringed ships in the game.

Her [[chibi]] battle sprite was one of the first to be revealed as a combatant in the Project R trailer .

In April 2016 Rodney was likened to English teacher [[Ellen Baker]] due to their almost identical looks and their English speaking backgrounds, with [[15k]] posting an image of Rodney swinging one of her main turrets like a baseball bat.

She is based on the British Royal Navy's "HMS Rodney":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMS_Rodney_(29)] a Nelson-class inter-war warship named after "Admiral George Brydges Rodney":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Brydges_Rodney,_1st_Baron_Rodney]. Armed with 16-inch [[cannon|main guns]] she was one of the [i]Big Seven[/i] warships. Her ship index number is 9.

Her official artist is [[15k]].

title: de_ruyter_(kancolle)
body:
A [[Kantai Collection]] character based on HNLMS De Ruyter, which was a unique light cruiser of the Royal Netherlands Navy. She is one of many ships named after Dutch naval hero Admiral "Michiel Adriaenszoon de Ruyter":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michiel_de_Ruyter. She is the first ever Dutch shipgirl as well as the first ever shipgirl for her artist [[Sara (kadokawa)|]].

De Ruyter has [[long hair|long]] [[curly hair|curly]] brownish [[red hair]] with a [[side braid]] and [[blunt bangs]], and [[green eyes]]. She wears a [[serafuku]] consisting of a [[brown shirt|beige]] [[sailor shirt]] with a [[green sailor collar]], an [[orange neckerchief]] and [[chain]]s held by a golden [[bell]], and a [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]] as well as a [[black belt]] with more chains and [[anchor]]s, short [[black thighhighs|black]] [[over-kneehighs|over-knee socks]], and [[green footwear|green]] [[high_heels|high-heeled]] [[shoes]]. Her [[machinery]] includes six of her seven 150-mm guns ([[adapted turret|she holds the seventh in her hand]]), her tall forward superstructure, a [[smokestack]], and several smaller [[ship turret|turret]]s. She also wears a [[black hairband]] with midships aircraft catapult attached to it.

Because her artist is an in-house illustrator, she got her first seasonal CG almost three weeks after she was introduced into the game through the 2019 Autumn event while said event was still ongoing. This seasonal CG, a Christmas-themed one, shows her wearing a [[red dress]] with a [[corset]], a [[white skirt|white]] pleated skirt, a [[white capelet]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], a [[holly hair ornament]], black thighhighs, and [[fur-trimmed_boots|fur-trimmed]] [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. She also has a [[Setsubun]] CG where she wears a [[red coat|red]] [[plaid coat]], a [[brown sweater]], a [[black skirt|black]] pleated skirt, an [[orange scarf]], black thighhighs, and black [[fur-trimmed boots]].

She comes off as a preppy girl who has a penchant for using the expression "Yabai" in both good and bad contexts.

The historical De Ruyter was laid down on 16 September 1933 at the Wilton-Fijenoord dockyard in Schiedam and commissioned on 3 October 1936. She was sunk in the Battle of the Java Sea in 1942.

h4. See Also
* [[list of Kantai Collection characters]]

h4. External Links
* "Wikipedia: HNLMS De Ruyter (1935)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HNLMS_De_Ruyter_(1935)]

デロイテル(艦隊これくしょん)

title: graf_zeppelin_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]] personification of the German aircraft carrier [i]Graf Zeppelin[/i].
Character design by [[Shimada Fumikane]], voiced by [[Hayami Saori]].

h4. Personality
Graf Zeppelin has a confident, militaristic, blunt, and stoic manner of speech. Her [[official art|(official) art]] style has her looking quite cold and nearly monochrome, most likely to reflect on her historic counterpart's noncompletion. She is frequently seen in the company of the other German ships, especially [[bismarck (kancolle)|Bismarck]] and [[prinz eugen (kancolle)|Prinz Eugen]], and occasionally as having a senpai-kouhai relationship with [[Akagi (kancolle)|Akagi]], from whom some of her flight deck design was copied. As her hourlies implies, she's an avid coffee drinker, making coffee up to four times between 10 pm to 7 am.

h4. Appearance
She has [[grey eyes]] in [[tsurime]] style. She has [[blonde hair]] with notable [[sidelocks]] and [[twintails]], as well as [[hair between eyes|hair dangling between her eyes]].

She wears a white [[jacket]] that is unmistakably [[impossible_clothes|impossibly tight]] on her [[large breasts]] and even shows her navel. She also wears a [[capelet]] with red trim, a black-and-red [[necktie]] bearing a black (iron) [[cross]], a black [[miniskirt]], [[black pantyhose]], black [[gloves]] and a [[peaked cap]].

Her [[machinery|combat gear]] involves a split-hull design similar to KanColle battleships like [[Nagato (kancolle)|Nagato]]. Unlike Japanese carriers, she carries no historical weapon representing aircraft launching, instead holding a small deck of two twin-[[cannon]] anti-air [[ship turret|turrets]] like a pistol. Her hull also has twin-cannon turrets. Her carrier deck is carried on a robotic swing arm from the back of the hull that is attached to her back on a metal girdle.

h4. History
The historic Graf Zeppelin was also notable for incorporating design flaws the other major powers had already learned to avoid. Graf Zeppelin's surface armament was 16 single-purpose 15 cm guns in 8 twin-mount casemates, at a time when other countries were arming their carriers with smaller dual-purpose guns to increase their anti-air coverage. These guns were of heavy cruiser size, numbered more than a heavy cruiser would carry for "commerce raiding operations" and would have required the carrier to come into direct surface engagement range to actually use. This was in fact the result of miscommunication with the ship's designer, who intended to save weight by using 4 twin-mount instead of 8 single-mount casemates; the builders thought that he was instead telling them to double the total number of guns. In game, though, this trait is the reason she's able to attack during night battles, the first night carrier in the game (though not night airstrike combat-capable).

h4. See also
* [[Graf Zeppelin (Azur Lane)]]
** [[Peter Strasser (Azur Lane)|Her unbuilt sister ship Peter Strasser]]
* [[Graf Zeppelin (Warship Girls R)]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: [i]Graf Zeppelin[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/German_aircraft_carrier_Graf_Zeppelin]

title: nelson_(warship_girls_r)
body:
A battleship class character in [[Warship Girls R]].

Nelson has [[orange hair|orange]] sometimes bordering [[red hair|red]] hair pulled back into a [[long hair|long]] low [[ponytail]] which can often be missed and [[blue eyes]]. A mole sits just beneath her [[mole under eye|right eye]] which she keeps [[one eye closed|closed]] at all times. Her outfit is based on Horatio Nelson's admiral [[military uniform|uniform]]. An embroidered black coat with golden [[epaulettes]] and trim sits atop a white frilled undershirt with her right sleeve rolled up to the elbow. White [[gloves]], a red [[skirt]] and a pair of black [[thighhighs|thighhigh]] boots finish the outfit off. She's also personally armed with a Royal Navy officers' sword with a black grip and golden hilt. Her closed eye and rolled up sleeve are a reference to the permanent wounds suffered by Admiral Nelson.

A large portion of her machinery is located on her right side with all three of her triple 16-inch gun [[ship turret|turrets]] representing the design of the Nelson-class where all main armaments were located forward of the super structure. On her left a large curved shield in the shape of a ship's stern is used as protection. There are several additional turrets of double 6-inch guns located on the inner ring of the machinery as a secondary armament with a mast in the back. 

She received a remodel (post #2244658) early in the game's life. Nelson's uniform mostly remains the same but with added [[medal|medals]], a red and blue [[sash]] draping down from her right shoulder, black [[garter straps]] attached to her boots and she clutches onto a golden [[pocket watch]].

The machinery is painted in green and blue camouflage. Two of her main turrets and the rear section of the machinery mounts an excessive number of single 20mm Oerlikon cannons and the central turret plays host to a 2 Pounder 8 Barrel "Pom-Pom" anti-air gun. The inner ring of equipment is removed with three of the four 6-inch turrets now located on the more ship like designed stern, better representing how these secondary batteries were positioned. The mast has also been replaced with a smokestack and the ship's conning tower with various gunnery and aircraft detecting radar.

A woman whose devotion to duty drives her to greater achievements she also endeavors to inspire those around her, [i]England expects that every man do his duty[/i] after all.

She is based on the lead ship of the British Royal Navy's Nelson-class inter-war warship "HMS Nelson":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMS_Nelson_(28)] named after "Vice Admiral Horatio Lord Nelson":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horatio_Nelson,_1st_Viscount_Nelson]. Armed with 16-inch [[cannon|main guns]], she was one of the [i]Big Seven[/i] warships. Her ship index number is 8.

Her official artist is [[15k]].

title: ancient_destroyer_oni
body:
[[abyssal ship|Abyssal]] boss in the game [[Kantai Collection]]. First appeared during the 2016 Fall Event.

Like many Abyssals, she has [[pale skin]], and [[glowing eyes|glowing]] [[blue eyes|eyes]]. There is a [[mole under eye|mole]] under her left eye. Her hair is [[short hair|short]] (or bound-up), [[black hair|black]] (with a white [[streaked hair|streak]]), and styled in the [[side_drill|very uncommon]] [[side ponytail|side]][[drill hair|-drill]]. Additionally, there is an [[anchor hair ornament]] on the end of a [[single sidelock]].

Her clothing is all blacks and greys. She is dressed in a [[meiji schoolgirl uniform]] that consists of a grey [[kimono]], black [[hakama skirt]] & [[obi]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heel boots|high-heeled]] [[boots]]. She also appears to wear [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves|elbow]] [[gloves]]. 

She is armed with a monstrous Abyssal [[cannon|gun]] [[ship turret|turret]], replete with one-and-a-half horrific, [[teeth|toothy]] maws, bristling with gun barrels, disturbingly organic-looking [[mechabare]], and a [[hose]] dangling from the bottom.

While it is [i]very[/i] easy to mistake her for [[Ancient Destroyer Princess]], there are some key differences:
* Oni looks far more intact and composed, while Princess looks significantly more damaged.
* Oni's Abyssal turret gun is one mouth grafted to another top set of teeth and a broken, incomplete jaw, while Princess's turret looks more completed: it has merged and integrated the two upper sets of teeth into one, centralized the lower jaw, and fixed up the machinery parts inside.
* Oni's hair is either shorter or pinned up, while Princess's is much longer and/or hanging down freely.
* Oni's side-drill is shorter.
* Oni lacks the white tasuki that Princess wears.

h4. See also

* [[kamikaze (kancolle)|]]
* [[battleship princess]]

title: ancient_destroyer_princess
body:
[[abyssal ship|Abyssal]] boss in the game [[Kantai Collection]]. First appeared during the 2016 Fall Event. Extremely similar in appearance to [[Ancient Destroyer Oni]].

She has [[pale skin]] and [[glowing eyes|glowing]] [[blue eyes|eyes]]--features common to most Abyssals--and a [[mole under eye|mole]] under her left eye. Her hair is [[long hair|long]], [[black hair|black]] (with a white [[streaked hair|streak]]), and styled in the [[side_drill|very uncommon]] [[side ponytail|side]][[drill hair|-drill]]. Additionally, there is an [[anchor hair ornament]] on the end of one of her unevenly-long[[sidelocks]].

Her black and grey clothing is noticeably [[torn clothes|shredded and torn]], apparently due to taking damage. She is dressed in a [[meiji schoolgirl uniform]] that consists of a grey [[kimono]], black [[hakama skirt]] & [[obi]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heel boots|high-heeled]] [[thigh boots|thigh]] [[boots]]. She also wears [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves|elbow]] [[gloves]] on her arms, and a white [[tasuki]] on her right shoulder.

Her gun is strangely much more put-together than she is: a monstrous Abyssal [[cannon|gun]] [[ship turret|turret]] mounted atop a mouth-and-a-half filled with [[teeth]], jaws, gun barrels, glowing [[energy]], and disturbingly organic-looking [[mechabare]]. The [[hose]] dangling from the bottom has detached and hangs loose.

While she is quite easily mistaken for [[Ancient Destroyer Oni]], there are some key differences:
* Princess looks like she's been through the wringer, as opposed to Oni, who seems quite undamaged.
* Princess's Abyssal gun turret looks more completed and properly built than Oni's; the two upper sets of teeth ahve been fixed and set neatly together, while the lower jaw sits in the center between them; the internal parts exposed by the open mouth look more deliberate and less haphazard.
* Princess's much longer hair hangs down in the back, while Oni's hair is either shorter or pinned up.
* Princess has a longer side-drill.
* Princess has a white tasuki on her right shoulder, while Oni does not.

h4. See also

* [[Kamikaze (kancolle)|]]
* [[Battleship Princess]]

title: deutschland_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the German pocket battleship/heavy cruiser [i]Deutschland[/i] in [[Azur Lane]]. Character design by [[Ran (Bukeranwu)]], voiced by [[Uesaka Sumire]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[streaked hair|streaked]] [[black hair]] with a red highlight in her bangs and a white highlight in her left sidelock. She has bright [[blue eyes]]. On her head is a [[black headwear|black]] [[peaked cap]] with a band of cloth fake teeth and [[goggles on headwear|goggles on it]]. She wears a [[double-breasted]] [[white shirt]] and a black [[long coat]] with red lining over it. On her left arm, she has a red [[armband]] with an [[iron cross]]. She wears [[black footwear|black]] [[lace-up boots]] with red soles and a noticeable heel. She has red armored/mechanical gloves.

Her [[rigging]] is a twin-hull design with two mechanical jaws for hulls. She has two triple-barreled [[ship turret|turrets]] attached to the side of each hull, and smaller secondary turrets atop them. She carries a handheld [[gun]] colored black and red, with a fake-tooth grin near the muzzle.

title: massachusetts_(azur_lane)
body:
Third ship of the US Navy's [i]South Dakota[/i]-class battleships, USS [i]Massachusetts[/i] (BB-59), in [[Azur Lane]]. Character design by [[Enka (bcat)|]], voiced by [[Takahashi Rie]].

She has [[multicolored hair]] being mostly white on the outside, while green-cyan or black on the inside. She has [[dark skin]] and several [[body markings]] near her collarbone and on her abdomen. Her outfit consists of a black and white [[bikini top only|bikini top]] where the straps are attached to a [[choker]] with a Native American-esque design, a pair of black [[short shorts]] and an [[open_jacket|open]], [[black jacket]] that hangs [[off_shoulder|off her shoulders]]. In addition, she wears [[camouflage_footwear|camo-patterned]] [[combat boots]]. Her hairstyle and dark complexion leads many players to note similarities to [[Altera (Fate)|]].

Her [[rigging]] features three triple-barreled [[ship turret|turrets]], two of which are suspended at her sides, while the third is attached to the back rigging. A small section of hull plating is suspended from the turrets as well as smaller secondary turrets. Her back rigging is her superstructure and conning tower, featuring a [[radar dish]].

In real life, [i]Massachusetts[/i] was the only one of the class to have initially seen frontline service in the Atlantic/Mediterranean theaters, bombarding Casablanca in November 1942 (leading to her gunnery exchange with [[Jean Bart (Azur Lane)|]], in anchor at that time). She was only transferred to the Pacific in early 1943 to replace her sister South Dakota (then headed stateside for repairs), seeing action escorting the carrier forces.

Post-war, she was decommissioned in 1947, but it took until 1965 for her to become a museum ship.

title: ajax_(azur_lane)
body:
h4. Description
Fourth ship of the Royal Navy Leander-class light cruisers, HMS [i]Ajax[/i], in [[Azur Lane]].

h5. Base Art
Ajax has [[long hair|long]], light [[purple hair]] with a [[two side up]] and [[pink eyes]]. Her outfit consists of a strapless white top and a [[red skirt|red]] [[high-waist skirt]] with [[plaid trim]] around the waist. She has a white [[capelet]] adorning her shoulders tied with a [[yellow bow]] and an [[aiguillette]]. She wears [[black pantyhose]] and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]]. She has a pair of black, [[long sleeves|long]], [[detached sleeves]]. Topping off her head is a [[white headwear|white]] [[beret]] with red trim.

Her [[rigging]] is a spider-style design with four twin [[ship turret|turrets]] and two quad [[torpedo tubes]].

h5. Retrofit
For detailed information, see her [[Ajax (retrofit) (azur lane)|corresponding page.]]

title: asakaze_(kancolle)
body:
Asakaze (lit. "Morning Wind") is the second of nine [[kamikaze (kancolle)|Kamikaze]]-class destroyers as personified in [[Kantai Collection]].

h4. Appearance

Similar to [[kamikaze (kancolle)|Kamikaze]], Asakaze wears a [[Meiji schoolgirl uniform]] with a white [[furisode]] top, including a gradient to blue in the loose sleeves, along with a cobalt blue [[hakama skirt]] tied with a sash bearing an [[anchor]] on the end, and [[knee_boots|knee-high]] [[lace-up boots]]. She has [[blue eyes]] and [[long_hair|long]], [[wavy_hair|wavy]] [[light brown hair]] with [[parted_bangs|her bangs parted in the middle]] providing long [[sidelocks]] and exposing her [[forehead]]. She also wears two large blue [[hair_ribbon|hair ribbons]] on either side of her head.

Her [[machinery|rigging]] includes a [[smokestack|funnel]] attached to her back with an adjoining mast and twin-tube [[torpedo]] launcher. To her sides, at thigh-level, are cutoff-ship-deck-like platforms that bear a single-[[cannon]] [[ship turret|turret]]. She also carries a single-cannon turret in her left hand like a pistol, which is modeled like a ship's bow bearing the number "5". 

h4. Personality

Asakaze has an energetic personality, proud of her accomplishments but also highly sensitive to criticism. Her in-game lines include several instances of indignation over perceptions of anyone "making fun of her" even when none existed. Possibly because of the meaning her name, she also seems to love mornings, getting up at 4 AM to see the sunrise. Inversely, she becomes notably more nervous at night, likely due to the circumstances of her sinking.

h4. History

Originally commissioned merely as "Destroyer No. 3" as part of the "8-8 Fleet Program,":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eight-eight_fleet the name [i]Asakaze[/i] was only assigned in 1928, five years after launch. At the time of the Attack on Pearl Harbor, [i]Asakaze[/i] was part of Destroyer Division 5, alongside sister-ships [i][[harukaze (kancolle)|Harukaze]][/i], [i]Matsukaze[/i], and [i]Hatakaze[/i].

Already aging by the start of the war, Asakaze mostly escorted landing craft in campaigns like "the Philippines":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippines_Campaign_(1941%E2%80%9342)], "Java":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Java], and "Andaman Islands":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Invasion_and_occupation_of_the_Andaman_Islands_during_World_War_II]. At the "Battle of Sunda Straight":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Sunda_Strait], [i]Asakaze[/i] launched torpedoes that assisted in the sinking of HMAS [i]Perth[/i] and USS [i]Houston[/i].

Throughout most of the rest of the war, she was a convoy escort ship. [i]Asakaze[/i] was torpedoed by the submarine USS [i]Haddo[/i] at 22:35 on August 23rd near Luzon while on escort duty. During the night, efforts to save her proved unsuccessful, and in the pre-dawn hours of August 24th, she capsized and sank. 

h4. Trivia

Although she was the second of the nine Kamikaze-class destroyers, due to IJN numbering at the time she was listed as "Destroyer No. 3" at launch due to sharing a number scheme with the "Wakatake-class destroyers":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wakatake-class_destroyer].

Her seiyuu is [[Itou Shizuka]].

h4. [i]Kamikaze[/i]-class Destroyers
* [[Kamikaze (kancolle)|]] - first Kamikaze-class destroyer
* [b]Asakaze[/b]
* [[Harukaze (kancolle)|]] - third Kamikaze-class destroyer
* [[Matsukaze (kancolle)|]] - fourth Kamikaze-class destroyer
* [[Hatakaze (kancolle)|]] - fifth Kamikaze-class destroyer

h4. External links
* "Kancolle Wiki: Asakaze":http://en.kancollewiki.net/Asakaze

* "Wikipedia: Japanese destroyer Asakaze (1922)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_destroyer_Asakaze_(1922)]

title: zara_(kancolle)
body:
[i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s personification of the Italian heavy cruiser [i]Zara[/i]. Character design by [[Jiji (Aardvark)|]], voiced by [[Akasaki Chinatsu]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[blonde hair]], [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]].

Her default outfit consists of a [[white shirt]] with [[bare shoulders|shoulder]] and [[armpits|armpit cuts]], a black [[bodice]], [[red skirt]] with [[anchor|anchors]] attached, [[brown pantyhose]], [[grey footwear|grey boots]], red [[ascot]] and a [[mini hat]] patterned off her real-life fire control director. Her [[rigging]] is composed of two main hull pieces containing her four 203 mm twin [[ship turret|turrets]].

For her [[Zara due (Kancolle)|second remodel]], she loses the pantyhose and wears a [[garters|garter]] on her left thigh, while her skirt becomes [[layered skirt|layered]], with a layer of white underneath the red. She gains a [[cleavage cutout]] in her corset, and her boots now have [[high heels]]. Her hair now features a [[side braid]] on the left side of her face. For her machinery, the positions of her turrets is altered, and she gains additional secondary batteries and anti-aircraft guns. She now wields a [[seaplane]] launcher that resembles a [[Breda 30]].

title: saberface
body:
A concept in [[Fate (series)|]] works originating from [[Takeuchi Takashi]]'s fondness for his character design of [[Saber (fate)|]] from [[Fate/stay night]]. As a result, many characters throughout the franchise are [[look-alike]]s resembling her, whether or not they were designed by Takeuchi.

This tag applies when [b]at least 3[/b] Saberfaces appear in a work, especially when they're grouped together. This doesn't apply to multiple variants of the same Saberface (i.e. [[alter servant]]s), where [[dual persona]] or [[multiple persona]] should be used instead.

Saberfaces include:
* [[Artoria Pendragon (fate)|]]
* [[Mordred (fate)|]]
* [[Jeanne d'Arc (fate)|]]/[[Jeanne d'Arc Alter (fate)|]]/[[Jeanne d'Arc Alter Santa Lily (fate)|]]
* [[Laeticia (fate)|]]
* [[Nero Claudius (fate)|]]
* [[Okita Souji (fate)|]]
* [[Gray (fate)|]]
* [[Corpse King (fate)|]]
* [[Morgan le Fay (fate)|]]
* [[Le Loi (fate)|]]
* [[Lakshmibai (fate)|]]
* [[Aesc (fate)|]]

[[Hippolyta (fate)|]] has the same [[bun with braided base|hairstyle]] as Artoria but different facial features, so she's not a Saberface.

[[Yamato Takeru (fate)|]] was described by Takeuchi as a Saberface in an interview, but isn't considered one by [[Mysterious Heroine X (fate)|]] or in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[gameplay mechanics]].

h4. See Also
* pool #18457

title: grill
body:
A cooking device with a metal frame of parallel or crisscrossing bars used for cooking food over fire or other heating means.

This tag is not used for the UK definition for grill, which is a surface that can be heated to very high temperatures and under which you put food to be cooked.  That device is known as a broiler in the US.

h4. Types

* [[Kettle grill]]
* [[Shichirin]]

h4. See also

* [[Griddle]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: kettle_grill
body: A kettle grill is a charcoal [[grill]] consisting of half-spherical shaped grill with domed lid.  The base typically features support legs and may also feature a cylindrical ash catcher at the bottom.  The design was invented by George Stephen Sr. and was constructed from sheet metal half-spheres originally for building [[buoy]]s.  The American manufacturer Weber Inc. was the original maker of these grills, so the iconic design is closely associated with them.

title: kaku_seiga
body:
The "Wicked Hermit Who Passes Through Walls", also nicknamed Seiga Nyan Nyan  (青娥 娘々 [せいが にゃんにゃん]), lit. Lady Seiga. Stage 4 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Ten Desires]] and owner of [[Miyako Yoshika]] respectively. Often also seen with [[Ibaraki Kasen]] as a fellow hermit. 

Her name came from the title and name of the heroine of "青娥":[https://zh.wikisource.org/wiki/聊齋志異/第07卷#.E9.9D.92.E5.A8.A5], an episode from "Strange Tales from a Chinese Studio":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strange_Tales_from_a_Chinese_Studio Volume 7.

h4. Appearance
* !post #1500910

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]] with [[drill sidelocks]] and her [[hair stick]] through her [[hair rings]]. Her outfit is a [[blue dress]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[collared vest|collared]] [[open vest|open]] [[white vest]], a [[blue belt]] with a [[white flower]], [[white socks]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]]. She is often holding her [[ofuda]] or her [[hagoromo]]. 

Seiga's [[hair stick]] is actually a "Wall-Removing Chisel" that lets her pass [[through wall| through walls]]. It is likely based on a [[chisel]]-shaped magical digging tool that appeared in [i]Strange Tales from a Chinese Studio[/i].

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Seiga Kaku":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Seiga_Kaku

title: tbh_creature_(meme)
body:
* !post #7052177: Yippee!

A four-legged white [[creature]] with a large head and [[pleading eyes|beady black eyes]] originally created by the "Twitter user @acmeiku.":https://twitter.com/acmeiku/status/1345224350551732225 It was popularized by a meme that took the drawing, added a confetti effect, and a voice clip of a child saying "Yippee!" 

It became the unofficial "mascot" of the [[autism|autistic]] community after a Tumblr user posted it with the caption "so obsessed with that thing, it's like the spokesperson for autism".

On Tumblr, it is commonly drawn interacting with [[Among Us]] [[crewmate (among us)|]]s.

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: TBH / Autism Creature / Yippee":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/tbh-autism-creature-yippee

title: learning_with_manga!_fgo
body:
Official [[Fate/Grand Order]] comic handled by [[Riyo (lyomsnpmp)|]], distributed on the official F/GO website since August 2015. Ostensibly, by the title, one would learn about the daunting mechanics and immersive world of F/GO with [[Fujimaru Ritsuka (female)|]] and friends... except this "annoying looking" female Ritsuka, otherwise known as Gudako, is a gacha junkie. Elsewhere, a similarly "annoying looking" male [[Fujimaru Ritsuka (male)|Gudao]] is adventuring and engaging in homoerotic shenanigans, though he isn't the only one in the world doing so.

A smash hit with fans, the original run from August to November 2015 would be followed up by [i]More Learning with Manga! F/GO[/i], lasting from December 2015 to July 2017, and by [i]Even More Learning with Manga! F/GO[/i] since August 2017, each only occasionally as informative as it could be. Further popularized [[Riyo (lyomsnpmp) (style)|]]'s style, and would inspire countless fanart with its scenarios and quotable scenes. Would also introduce a number of original characters, listed below.

h4. Original characters
[tn]If named, they have probably been implemented into F/GO.[/tn]
* [[Rider (learning With Manga! Fgo)|Rider]] "Bunnygirl"
* [[Assassin (learning With Manga! Fgo)|Assassin]] "Babydoll"
* [[Paul Bunyan (Fate)|]]
* [[Mary Anning (fate)|]]
* [[Archer (learning With Manga! Fgo)|Archer]] "Bronco"
* [[Daikokuten (fate)|]]
* [[Saber (learning With Manga! Fgo)|Saber]] "Bearing"
* [[Lizzie Borden (Fate)|]] [tn](not implemented)[/tn]

title: otonashi_kotori
body:
An office clerk at 765 Production, Kotori is a character in The [[Idolmaster]].
Among the few things disclosed about her personality and character, Kotori is a little older than [[Miura Azusa]] (making her somewhere in her twenties), and despite not being an idol herself, loves to sing. She is typically regarded as a [[fujoshi]], but also carries some [[himejoshi]] traits in the 2011 anime.

Her last name literally means "soundless" and her first name means "little bird".


Usually depicted with [[short_hair|short]] [[green hair]], a [[mole]] on the [[mole_under_mouth|right side]] of her chin and a yellow [[headset]]

title: parfait
body:
A dessert, similar to a [[sundae]], made up of layers of [[ice cream]] or cream and [[fruit]] and/or fruit gelatin, served in a tall glass that makes all layers visible.

Usually eaten with a long-handle [[ice cream spoon]].

Many posts actually refer to the "American parfait":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_parfait while the traditional French parfait is made up of custard, cream, and fruit puree.

title: carl_carlson
body:
Carlton Carlisle "Carl" Carlson, Jr. is a recurring character in [[The Simpsons]] and a supporting character in The Simpsons Movie. He is a safety operations supervisor from Sector 7G of the Springfield Nuclear Power Plant, where he works alongside his childhood friends [[Lenny Leonard]] and [[Homer Simpson]].

Carl is a self-restrained organized (although not maniac about it, like Frank Grimes) employee and likes to call himself "an urban Lenny". It is hinted in the series that he and Lenny may be more than just friends.

title: lenny_leonard
body: Lenford Landon "Lenny" Leonard is a recurring character in [[The Simpsons]], and a supporting character in The Simpsons Movie. He is the best friend of [[Carl Carlson]] and, along with Carl, second best friend of [[Homer Simpson]], behind [[Barney Gumble]] and [[Moe Szyslak]]. He works at the Springfield Nuclear Power Plant and possesses a master's degree in nuclear physics, but he is portrayed as a simple, often naive, blue-collar working man. Lenny is also one of the few characters allowed to possess a "Simpson's Family" trait: Homer's beard line. He is also seen having extreme dandruff in some episodes.

title: astra_zero
body:
Artist who creates homoerotic artwork in a [[realistic]] [[painterly]] style.
The artist uses [[3D]] models for pose reference and claims to repaint the faces using [[procreate_(medium)|Procreate]] on "their twitter post":[https://x.com/astrazero/status/1768785081450324277] (asset #23940203). 
Despite this, there are significant differences between the styles in which they draw faces between 2022 and 2023, in which he [i]possibly[/i] started to inpaint faces using [[AI-assisted|AI]] with [[photorealistic]] models.
h4. Examples
* !asset #23940463

title: adepta_sororitas
body: The [b]Adepta Sororitas[/b] (Sisters of Battle) are a [[Warhammer 40K]] tabletop army. Generally considered the female equivalent to [[Adeptus astartes|Space Marines]], in that they are warrior nuns divided into chapters, wearing [[power armor]] and wielding [[bolter]]s. The Sisters of Battle are considerably more fanatical than their male counterparts, making greater use of religious iconography and symbolism.

title: benghuai_xueyuan
body:
Chinese title: 崩坏学园2 (Benghuai Xueyuan 2) ~ The End of School
English titles: "Guns GirlZ - Mirage Cabin / Escape Ragnarok" (NA) or "Guns Girl - Honkai Gakuen / School DayZ" (SEA)
Japanese title: 崩壊学園 (Houkai Gakuen)

A Chinese smartphone game developed by Mihoyo about three cute girls trying to make their way out from zombie apocalypse; part of the [[Honkai (series)|]] series.

Originally just 崩坏学园 (Benghuai Xueyuan) ~ The End of School, known in English as Zombiegal Kawaii, before it was updated into Benghuai Xueyuan 2.

Since the two games are mostly unrelated, unless it's a collaboration, [b]do not[/b] tag [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] when uploading posts from official sites ("Bilibili":[https://space.bilibili.com/133934], "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/Houkaigakuen],...) or posts that have [b]崩坏学园2[/b]/[b]崩壊学園[/b]/[b]Guns GirlZ[/b] logo.

title: rose_(nikke)
body:
An NPC from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]].

The late sister of [[Scarlet (nikke)|]]. She and her sister were members of a Nikke squad specialized in melee combat. Rose was also the original wielder of Fleetly Fading, Scarlet's signature weapon.

[spoiler]Upon realizing the nature of their squad where they are sent on numerous harsh missions in order to convert the last surviving member as a Grimms model, Rose incited a mutiny and murdered their former commander alongside other members of their squad who opposed the idea. Scarlet would eventually clash her sister in a duel, resulting in Rose's eventual demise.

title: hau_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Hau[/b] is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon sm|Sun and Moon]][/i].

An optimist whose constant smiling is infectious, he loves [[malasada|malasadas]] and fun. He takes Pokémon battles where Trainers are in sync with their Pokémon very seriously.

He is [[dark-skinned male|dark skinned]], has [[grey eyes]], and [[green hair]] worn in a [[short ponytail]]. He wears an [[orange bag|orange]] [[backpack]], a [[black shirt]], [[orange shorts|orange]] [[floral print]] shorts, and [[orange footwear|orange]] [[shoes]].

title: cross_calibur_(fate)
body:
[[Mysterious Heroine X Alter (Fate)|]]'s weapon. It is often seen resembling a [[red lightsaber|red]] [[double bladed lightsaber]], but originally took a form resembling a [[glowing sword|glowing red]] [[energy sword]] variant of [[Himitsucalibur (Fate)|]] and by extension [[Excalibur (fate/stay night)|]] with red markings on its [[hilt]]. It can also transform into a [[chainsaw]].

Similarly to [[Himitsucalibur (fate)|]], if its portrayed in its original form without the [[glowing sword|glowing]] element, it may simply be tagged as [[Excalibur (fate/stay night)|]].

h4. See Also
* [[Excalibur Morgan (fate)|]]
* [[Himitsucalibur (fate)|]]
* [[Lumino Calibur (fate)|]], [[Mysterious Idol X Alter (fate)|]]'s weapon

title: himitsucalibur_(fate)
body:
[b]Unsigned Sword of Victory[/b]

The two swords wielded by [[Mysterious Heroine X (fate)|]]. They resemble [[Excalibur (fate/stay night)|]] and [[Excalibur Morgan (fate)|]], but can [[glowing sword|glow]] like a [[lightsaber]]. They take on more futuristic appearances in her [[Mysterious Heroine X (third ascension) (fate)|third ascension]].

For tagging purposes, these should only be tagged as Himitsucalibur when visibly glowing or in their third ascension forms. Otherwise they can be tagged with their regular versions, [[Excalibur (fate/stay night)|]] and [[Excalibur Morgan (fate)|]].

h4. See Also
* [[Cross Calibur (fate)|]], [[Mysterious Heroine X Alter (fate)|]]'s weapon

title: golden_diva
body:
Boss of the Golden Passage and the final boss of [i][[Wario Land 4]][/i]. An ugly, extravagant ghost woman who covers her face in [[kabuki]] [[noh mask|okame masks]] and proudly wears the stolen jewelry of [[Princess Shokora]]. 

She is the one that took over the Golden Pyramid and cursed the ruins due to her greed, making Princess Shokora lose her original form in the process.

title: meica_(vtuber)_(1st_costume)
body:
The current costume of the [[indie virtual youtuber|Indie VTuber]] [[Meica (vtuber)|]], as seen in post #6372753. Illustrated by [[Kisaragi Yuri]].

She wears a [[green dress]] with [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[juliet sleeves]] and a [[black capelet|black]] [[half capelet]], layered over a white [[single-shoulder shirt]] which has a [[see-through shirt|see-through]] midriff, [[sleeveless shirt|no sleeves]] and is fastened by a [[chest belt]]. She also wears [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]] with [[cross-laced_shorts|side lacing]] and [[o-ring thigh strap]]. Her legwear is [[uneven legwear|uneven]] and consists of a [[single thighhigh]] and a [[single over-kneehigh]], both with a [[black thighhighs|black]] and [[green thighhighs|green]] [[gradient legwear|gradient]] color and [[sparkle print|sparkle prints]]. Lastly, the outfit has [[black footwear|black]] [[high heel boots]]. Her accessories are a [[compass]], a [[black choker]] with a [[sprout pendant]] and a [[bow (weapon)|bow]].

title: catbat_(wario_land)
body: Boss of the Sapphire Passage in [i][[Wario Land 4]][/i]. A ghostly, grotesque [[cat]] and [[bat]] hybrid with a [[open_mouth|large mouth]] and [[long tongue]].

title: aerodent
body: Boss of the Topaz Passage in [i][[Wario Land 4]][/i]. A ghostly [[mouse_(animal)|rodent]] that inflates and hides behind a giant [[teddy bear]].

title: spoiled_rotten
body:
Boss of the Entry Passage in [i][[Wario Land 4]][/i]. A large, round pink eggplant creature that carries a [[doll]].

Notable for being the only boss in the game that is not a ghostly entity, doesn't contain any of the Golden Pyramid's treasures and doesn't revive after you beat the game.

title: cractus
body:
Boss of the Emerald Passage in [i][[Wario Land 4]][/i]. A giant, drooling ghostly plant that resembles a [[venus flytrap]].

Another Cractus appears in [i][[WarioWare: Move It!]][/i]  during [[Kat_(warioware)|Kat]] & [[Ana_(warioware)|Ana]]'s story. This Cractus has a slightly different design, with much more protruding leaves around it's head, lacking spikes on arm-leaves, no longer having visible white sharp teeth and due to no longer being a ghost is firmly planted in the ground with no ability to float. This Cractus also commands a legion of lesser plant appendages that also have eyes and mouths. 

While the Cractus in [i]Wario Land 4[/i] is named [b]Furawana[/b] (フラワナ) in japanese, the Cractus' name in [i]WarioWare: Move It![/i] is slightly different, being named [b]Furawani[/b] (フラワニ)

title: roman_sionis
body: Black Mask (Roman Sionis) is a supervillain appearing in comic books published by [[DC Comics]]. Created by Doug Moench and Tom Mandrake, the character debuted in [[Batman]] #386 (August 1985).He is commonly depicted as a brutal and ruthless crime lord in Gotham City who has a fixation with masks and derives sadistic pleasure from the act of torture. Black Mask is one of the most enduring enemies of the superhero Batman and belongs to the collective of adversaries that make up his rogues gallery.

title: gm_iii
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Gundam ZZ]] from 1986.

[b]RGM-86R GM III[/b]

The final mass-produced refit of the venerable (but aging and underperforming) [[gm_(mobile_suit)|GM]] [[mobile suit]] series. It was first deployed during The First [[Neo Zeon]] War. Used by the [[Earth Federation]], its [[earth_federation_space_forces|EFSF]] branch (both in red and white/blue and white colors) and the [[aeug|AEUG/Karaba]] (in green and white colors). 

While its outside appearance is mostly the same, it's faster, has better electronics, can be equipped with [[missile pod]]s and possesses reinforced armor in select parts. Distinguishable by the pair of [[radio antenna]]s on its head unit, resembling the [[Ideon]].

Preceded by the [[GM II]] and succeeded by the [[Jegan]].

h4. Related development
* [[GM III Powered]]

title: bryan_cranston
body:
Bryan Lee Cranston (born March 7, 1956) is an American actor. He is best known for portraying [[Walter White]] in the AMC crime drama series [[Breaking Bad]] (2008–2013) and Hal in the Fox sitcom [[Malcolm in the Middle]] (2000–2006). He has received a number of awards, including six Primetime Emmy Awards, two Tony Awards, and two Golden Globes, in addition to nominations for an Academy Award and a BAFTA Award.
Cranston's voice acting includes English dubbing of anime (for which he primarily used the non-union pseudonym Lee Stone), including [[Macross Plus]] and [[armitage iii|Armitage III: Poly-Matrix]] and most notably [[Street Fighter II: The Animated Movie]] as [[Fei Long]].
other_names: ブライアン・クランストン

title: malcolm_in_the_middle
body:
Malcolm in the Middle is an American television sitcom created by Linwood Boomer for the Fox Broadcasting Company. The series premiered on January 9, 2000, and ended on May 14, 2006, after seven seasons consisting of 151 episodes.
The single-camera series is a family black comedy that follows a dysfunctional working class family and stars Frankie Muniz in the lead role as Malcolm, a child prodigy. The ensemble cast includes Jane Kaczmarek and [[Bryan Cranston]] as Malcolm's parents, Lois and Hal. Christopher Kennedy Masterson, Justin Berfield, and Erik Per Sullivan appear as Malcolm's brothers, Francis, Reese, and Dewey, respectively. Typical plots revolve around the family's dysfunctional relationships and inability to fit into society, with Malcolm regularly making asides to the camera to comment on their failures. Another brother, Jamie (James and Lukas Rodriguez), was introduced as the fifth son of Hal and Lois at the end of season four. The show was notable for its pop punk influences and portrayal of 2000s youth culture.

title: walter_white
body:
The main protagonist of [[Breaking Bad]].

Also known as "[b]Heisenberg[/b]" in honor of the late "Werner Heisenberg":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Werner_Heisenberg], White is a skilled chemist who could barely support his family. After being diagnosed with lung cancer, Walter became a drug dealer alongside with his former student, [[Jesse Pinkman]].

Portrayed by [[Bryan Cranston]].

title: israel-hamas_war
body:
A [[war]] primarily between [[Israel]] and Hamas militants and allies centred around the [[gaza|Gaza Strip]], [[Palestine]] that began on October 7th, 2023, with Hamas' attack on Israeli settlements and military outposts surroundng the Gaza Strip. Israel accused Hamas of indiscriminately killings civilians in order to justify a full scale invasion of the Gaza Strip to "neutralize Hamas once and for all".

The war quickly devolved into a full-scale invasion of the Gaza Strip by the [[Israel Defense Forces]], with multiple cases of scorched earth tactics used by the IDF, levelling Palestinian settlements and starving the population (a charge Israel denies, often claiming their attacks are "precision strikes" against Hamas), along with various claims and evidence of atrocities committed by the IDF. This led to call for ceasefire and support for Palestine around the world.

The war has also spilled over into various other Middle Eastern countries, particularly countries under the influence of [[Iran]] such as [[Syria]], [[Lebanon]], and the Houthi-controlled areas of [[Yemen]], while Israel receives military and political support from the [[United States]] and NATO, which led some analysts to consider the war a proxy conflict between the US and Iran.

The conflict has brought the overall Israel-Palestine conflict into the public forefront, and has been a divisive topic that has been both defended and condemned to the most extreme extent. Supporters of Palestine often condemn the war as an example of "continued European colonization" and of genocidal oppression, while supporters of Israel argue that Israel has the right to "defend themselves" against hostile forces, regardless of the ways in which this is achieved.

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:history]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel%E2%80%93Hamas_war]
other_names: 年パレスチナ・イスラエル戦争

title: the_baron_(mimi_wo_sumaseba)
body: A character that appeared first in the [[Studio Ghibli]] movie [[Mimi wo Sumaseba]], then in [[Neko no Ongaeshi]]. He is an animate cat figurine approximately a meter high, refined in manners and appearance and owner of the Cat Bureau. He is always in a [[tailcoat]] and/or [[vest]] (with [[wing collar]] and [[bowtie]]), along with [[top hat]] and [[cane]]. In the first movie he is an overall light brown color; in the second the lighter area around his elongated muzzle is larger, his ears are smaller, and the color of his suit has changed from tan to light gray. His full title and name is Baron Humbert von Gikkingen (バロン フンベルト フォン ジッキンゲン).

title: neko_no_ongaeshi
body:
A [[Studio Ghibli]] movie about a girl who accidentally ends up entangled in a plot to make her the bride of the prince of the Cat Kingdom after she unknowingly rescues him from a truck. The longer she stays in the kingdom, the more cat-like she becomes. Several other characters help her along the way, most notably [[the baron (mimi wo sumaseba)|Baron]] and [[Muta (neko no ongaeshi)|]].

It is an influential work in the [[furry]] genre in Japan.

title: reference_photo
body:
A [[photo (medium)|]] that has been used as a reference by an artist when creating an art piece. The result of using such references can range from detailed recreations of the photographs to simple copied poses, expressions, or situations.

[b]This tag is for the photos themselves[/b], not for images based on reference photos. Use when the post is wholly the reference material. If the reference photo is displayed alongside the referencing photo, use [[reference inset]] and [[photo inset]] instead.

Not to be confused with photos used in [[photo background]]s, which are not used as referenced to create the actual art piece.

h4. Example

* !asset #20076336: [b][[Reference photo]][/b]
* !post #7315357: [[Photo-referenced]]

h4. See also

* [[reference inset]]
* [[photo (medium)|]]
* [[photo inset]]
* [[photo-referenced]]

title: noah_(nikke)
body:
A playable character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. 

A widely recognized invincible shield of the surface that protects Inherit. She has possessed tremendous strength since she was a child, leading to her picking up some bad habits. The inherit squad is composed by [[Harran (Nikke)|]], [[Isabel (Nikke)|]], commanded by [[Johan (Nikke)|]].

Like all members of Inherit, Noah is named after the "Biblical figure of the same name":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Noah].

She has [[pink eyes]], [[pink hair|pink]] [[short hair]] and [[flat chest]]/[[small breasts]]. She carries a [[floating object|floating]] [[shield]], wears an [[armored bodysuit|armored]] [[black bodysuit]], large parts of her body are armored including [[armored boots]], [[armored gloves]], a [[breastplate]], [[pauldrons]], [[leg armor]], [[hip armor]] and a [[sparkle hair ornament]].

Illustrator: [[URORONG]]

title: shadow_trooper
body:
A highly trained variant of the [[stormtrooper]] in [[Star Wars]]. Shadow Troopers utilize experimental cloaking armor, distinguished by it's all-black coloration with an imperial insignia over the left chest.

Shadow Troopers primarily appear in Star Wars Legends video games and supplemental material, with their only post-Disney canon appearance being in DICE's 2015 Battlefront game. The [[Deathtrooper]]s introduced in [[rogue one: a star wars story|Rogue One]] have since been a semi-replacement for Shadow Troopers in the new canon.

title: star_wars:_the_clone_wars_(movie)
body:
Star Wars: The Clone Wars is a 2008 American animated space opera film directed by Dave Filoni, produced by Lucasfilm Ltd. and Lucasfilm Animation, and distributed by Warner Bros. Pictures, becoming the first [[Star Wars]] film to not be distributed by [[20th century studios|20th Century Fox]]. It is the first fully animated film in the Star Wars franchise and takes place shortly after [[star wars: attack of the clones|Episode II – Attack of the Clones]] (2002), at the start of the titular Clone Wars. In the film, [[Count Dooku]] and Jabba the Hutt's uncle Ziro orchestrate a plan to turn Jabba against the Galactic Republic by framing the [[Jedi]] for the kidnapping of his son. While [[Anakin Skywalker]] and his newly assigned apprentice [[Ahsoka Tano]] attempt to deliver the child back to his father, [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and [[Padme Amidala]] lead separate investigations to uncover Dooku and Ziro's plot.
The film serves as a pilot episode to the television [[star wars: the clone wars|series of the same name]], which premiered on [[Cartoon Network]] two months after the film's release.

title: rotta_the_hutt
body: Rotta, is a [[Star Wars]] character, he was a male Hutt and the son of [[Jabba the Hutt]]. During the Clone Wars, he was secretly kidnapped by the Confederacy of Independent Systems, which was orchestrated by [[Count Dooku]] with help from Ziro, Rotta's great-uncle. The plot was meant to discredit the [[jedi|Jedi Order]] and scuttle negotiations between the Galactic Republic and the Hutts, but the Jedi were able to rescue him. He was kidnapped by Asajj Ventress and taken to the planet Teth. A Jedi rescue team consisting of [[Anakin Skywalker]] and his Padawan [[Ahsoka Tano]] traveled to Teth to rescue him. He then became sick and nearly died on his way to Tatooine but survived thanks to Ahsoka Tano. After Anakin Skywalker and Tano evaded Dooku, who tried to kill Rotta and blame the Jedi, Rotta was returned to his father. Rotta was later present when Baron Notluwiski Papanoida visited Jabba's Palace. In 20 BBY, Ventress returned to [[Tatooine]], and wished to avoid attention from Jabba as she had previously kidnapped his son.

title: fenyon

Name derived from the French word "fainéant", meaning slacker or lazybones.

title: shorekeeper_(wuthering_waves)
body:
Playable character in [[Wuthering Waves]].

Leader of the Black Shores, a research organization that has developed a Lament (disaster) prediction system. [spoiler]Originally, when [[Rover (Wuthering Waves)|]] founded and led the Black Shores, Shorekeeper was their assistant. She was later granted leadership over the Black Shores and served as a key to the Tethys System's computations which guided the Black Shores' future activities.[/spoiler]

Shorekeeper does not have a [[Tacet Mark (Wuthering Waves)|]].

body:
Reusable and resealable [[water bottle]] designed for opening and drinking with one hand which is achieved by using flip-top, disc-top or push-pull cap. They are also more durable and usually have a more streamlined design than the normal cheap plastic bottles used for bottle water. 

While sports bottle can function like [[thermos]], the key difference is the ease of drinking with a sport bottle compared to a thermos.

Can be made from plastic, aluminum or ceramic.

title: terminator_armor

It is the toughest and most powerful form of personal armour humanity has ever developed, used by Terminator units. The scarcity and expense to maintain Terminator suits means they are available only to the elite troops from the veteran companies of the Space Marine Chapters.

title: rick_sanchez
body:
Titular character in [[Rick and Morty]].

The smartest man in the multiverse and depressed alcoholic. Grandfather of [[Morty Smith]] and [[Summer Smith]], father of [[Beth Smith]] and father-in-law of [[Jerry Smith]].

There are multiple versions of this character from different universes in the series. This tag can be used when any one of them is portrayed.

Rick was originally voiced by [[justin Roiland (person)|Justin Roiland]] from Season 1 to 6 but was later replaced by Ian Cardoni starting Season 7 due to Roiland being fired due to domestic abuses charges and his increasing unprofessional behavior at work.
H4.Alternative versions of Rick
* [[Pickle Rick]]
* [[Rick Prime]]

title: rick_prime
body:
Sanchez of the Prime Dimension, also known as Rick Prime, is the overarching antagonist of [[Rick and Morty]], as well as the catalyst for the events of the series.

He was the [[rick sanchez|Rick]] who was responsible for the deaths of Diane in every single dimension and Beth Sanchez in Dimension C-137.
Rick C-137 attempted to find and kill Rick Prime throughout the multiverse for decades, killing countless other Ricks in the process. Rick eventually landed in Rick Prime's original dimension and took his place, kickstarting the events of the series.

title: pickle_rick

title: alena_(dq4)
body: One of the main characters in [[Dragon Quest IV]]. Also known as Arena or Alina. Primarily a martial artist, using [[claws]] like the [[Martial Artist (dq3)|]] of [[Dragon Quest III]], she is the princess of Santohaim (localized as Santeem in the NES version and Zamoksva in the [[Nintendo DS]] remake). Alena is easily recognizable by her [[long hair|long]] [[curly hair|curly]] [[red hair]] (sometimes drawn [[orange hair|orange]] or [[brown hair|brown]]), [[cape]], and distinctive [[hat]]. In the DS remake, she has a Russian accent.

body:

Kaminari is not the sharpest tool in the shed, doing poorly in tests and often making a fool out of himself, especially if he overuses his electricity-generating quirk and short-circuits his brain. This usually leads to him being teased by [[Jiro Kyoka]].

He has parted [[blonde hair]] with a black lightning-shaped streak, fitting with his quirk.

title: jiro_kyoka
body:
Character from [[Boku no Hero Academia]].

A student in Class 1-A. Outspoken, snarky, and typically unenthusiastic, Jirou also has an interest in rock music (something she’s actually quite embarrassed about).

She has [[short hair|short]], indigo [[blue hair]] and [[black eyes]]. She sometimes wears red [[facial mark|facial marks]]. She has [[long earlobes]] shaped like [[audio jack]]s. There is a highlight on her hair that resembles the trace of a sound wave.

Her quirk is "earphone jack", which grants her the unique "earlobe jacks" that she can extend at will. She can plug the earlobe jack onto any surface to increase her sound reception from the distance, as well as using it to "amplify" her heartbeat to create an earthquake-like shockwave.

Her mother is [[Jirou Mika]].

title: aoyama_yuga
body:
Character from [i][[Boku no Hero Academia]][/i].

A student in Class 1-A. His Quirk gives him the ability to shoot lasers from his navel, though shooting for more than a second gives him stomach problems. A very flashy and narcissistic boy.

He has [[parted bangs|parted]] [[blonde hair|blond hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. He likes to [[sparkle]]. His hero costume resembles [[armor]].

title: tetsutetsu_tetsutetsu
body:
Character from [i][[Boku no Hero Academia]][/i].

A student in Class 1-B. A hot-blooded student with a hardening Quirk, much like his friendly rival [[Kirishima Eijiro]].

title: kirishima_eijiro
body:
Character from [[Boku no Hero Academia]]. A passionate young man who often brings up the concept of manliness, and admires tough guys. Often seen with [[Bakugou Katsuki]] and is one of the only students who tries to get along with him.

His Quirk allows him to harden his body, making it tough and rock-like.

He has [[red eyes]], [[spiked_hair|spiked]] [[red hair]] and [[sharp teeth]].

title: yaoyorozu_momo
body:
A character from Class 1-A in [i][[Boku no Hero Academia]][/i]. She is the class vice president alongside [[Iida Tenya]]. 

She is one of two students chosen to attend U.A. via recommendations. Intelligent and polite, Momo is seen as a natural leader, although she is prone to losing confidence, especially when comparing herself to [[Todoroki Shoto]].

Her quirk gives her the ability to make anything she has knowledge of using her body.

She has [[black hair]] [[hair_pulled_back|pulled back]]  in a [[ponytail]], and [[large breasts]]. Her hero costume is a red [[bodysuit]] with a [[center opening]], exposing her [[midriff]] and [[cleavage]] (in order to make more surface area available for creating large objects).

title: todoroki_rei
body: Character in [[Boku no Hero Academia]]. Wife of [[Endeavor (boku No Hero Academia)|Enji]], and the mother of [[Todoroki Shoto|Shouto]], [[Todoroki Natsuo|Natsuo]], [[Todoroki Fuyumi|Fuyumi]], and [[Todoroki Touya|Touya]].

title: endeavor_(boku_no_hero_academia)
body:
Pro hero from [i][[Boku no Hero Academia]][/i], the [[mature male|father]] of [[Todoroki Shoto]]. His [[beard]] and clothing appear to be on [[fire]].

His real name is Todoroki Enji.
Often with the hero [[Hawks (boku no hero academia)|]].

title: todoroki_shoto
body:
Character from [i][[Boku no Hero Academia]][/i].

A student in Class 1-A, chosen to enter U.A. via official recommendations. Despite being the ace of his class, Todoroki is very aloof and anti-social, although he gradually warms up to a few of his classmates as the story progresses.

His father, [[Endeavor (boku No Hero Academia)|Endeavor]], is the No. 2 Hero, but Todoroki holds a massive grudge against him thanks to a very rough childhood.

He has [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[red hair|red]] and [[white hair]], [[heterochromia]] (one [[grey eyes|grey]] and one [[blue eyes|blue]]), and a [[burn scar|burn]] [[scar on face| scar]]. His Quirk lets him produce [[fire]] from the left side of his body and [[ice]] from the right.

title: shinso_hitoshi
body:
Character from [[Boku no Hero Academia]].

He is voiced by [[Hatano Wataru]].

title: aizawa_shota
body:
The pro hero Eraser Head from [[Boku no Hero Academia]], although he is very obscure outside of U.A. since he dislikes media attention. He is the homeroom teacher of Class 1-A. 

He has [[black hair]] that's often [[messy hair|messy]] and [[stubble]] on his cheeks. He wears [[scarf|scarves]] that he uses to entangle enemies. Sometimes seen in a yellow [[sleeping bag]].

title: hair_horns
body:

h4. Examples

* [[Hado Nejire]] (hair spirals to form horns)
* [[Marnie (Pokemon)]] (natural hair spike)
* [[Mioda Ibuki]] (tightly curled hair cones)

h4. See also

* [[cone hair bun]]

title: awase_yosetsu
body: Character from [[Boku no Hero Academia]].

title: hado_nejire
body:
Character from [[Boku no Hero Academia]].

A third-year student at U.A. High School. Nejire's quirk allows her to convert her vitality into pure energy and to release this energy in the form of shockwaves. Nejire is enthusiastic, cheery, very talkative and endlessly curious girl, showing interest in other people's unique physical features and being easily distracted by them. She is a notably smart, thanks to her inquisitive and chatty demeanor. 

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[very long hair|extremely long]], [[light blue hair]] that reaches all the way down to her legs and apparently twists around itself at the waist area. She also wears a [[waistcoat]] over her [[school uniform]]. Her hero costume consists of a [[skin tight]] [[bodysuit]] and a pair of [[white gloves]] on her hands, as well as two strands of an unknown material (possibly her hair) that twist into [[drill hair|spiral horns]]. 

h4. External links

* "My Hero Academia Wiki: Nejire Hadou":http://bokunoheroacademia.wikia.com/wiki/Nejire_Hado

title: kendo_itsuka
body:
[i][[Boku no Hero Academia]][/i] character.

A student in class 1-B. She has [[green eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[orange hair]] in a [[side ponytail]]. Her quirk seems to be being able to enlarge and strengthen her hands.

title: midoriya_izuku
body:
The main protagonist of [[Boku no Hero Academia]]. Born without a Quirk and therefore dubbed “Quirkless”, Izuku has been relentlessly bullied by [[Bakugou Katsuki]] ever since he was four. In spite of being timid, he displays a strong admiration for heroes, often taking notes on their Quirks, and idolizes [[All Might]]. 

Often referred to as “Deku”, which is another reading of his name that can refer to a wooden figure or puppet. Bakugou uses it as an insult, while [[Uraraka Ochaco]] uses it affectionately. [spoilers]It has long since become his hero name.[/spoilers]

He has curly [[green hair]] and [[freckles]], and his hero costume consists of a [[green bodysuit]] with [[white gloves]] and a [[mask]]. Almost never seem without his iconic [[red footwear]]. Later on, [spoilers]a [[yellow cape]] is integrated into his hero costume.[/spoilers]

title: dragon_quest_iii
body:
The third game in the [i][[Dragon Quest]][/i] series, originally released in 1988 for the [[Famicom]] and later brought to North America (as [i]Dragon Warrior III[/i]) in 1991.  Enhanced remakes have since been made for the [[Super Famicom]] and [[Game Boy Color]], though only the latter was released outside of Japan. Much later, a HD-2D remake for modern consoles was released.

This game was the first to include a gender option for the main player-character.  It also introduced character classes to the series: [[Warrior (dq3)|]], [[Priest_(dq3)|]], [[Mage_(dq3)|]], [[Martial artist (dq3)|]], [[Merchant_(dq3)|]], [[Gadabout (dq3)|]], and [[Sage_(dq3)|]]. The Super Famicom remake introduced an additional [[Thief_(dq3)|]] class while the HD-2D remake introduced the [[Monster Wrangler (DQ3)|]].

title: griffin_&_kryuger
body:
[b]Griffin and Kryuger[/b] is a private military contractor and security consultant company in [[Girls' Frontline]], founded by [[griffin (girls' frontline)|Griffin Lyons]] and [[Berezovich Kryuger (girls' frontline)|]], and the employer of the player, the Commander. Besides humans, the PMC is known for its employment of androids (Dolls) built by the I.O.P. Manufacturing Company, modified for Tactical use (T-Dolls). At the start of the game, they're tasked with suppressing an AI rebellion that occurred in another company towards the west, [[Sangvis Ferri]].

title: fighter_jet
body:
A [[jet]]-powered [[aircraft]] specifically [[military vehicle|designed for warfare]], and outfitted with turbine jets. Fighting in conflicts as close support for ground troops, and maintaining air superiority in a dogfight. These crafts can travel at supersonic speeds of Mach 1, 2, and 3; armed with an array of guided and unguided penetration bombs, missiles, and vulcan cannons.

Pilots that fly them are equipped with a [[g-suit]] and an oxygen mask on their flight helmet, to allow them to withstand the heavy g-force from maneuvering the aircraft at supersonic speed, and to breathe easily while flying at altitudes of more than 20,000 feet.

title: satan_(mythology)
body:
In Western religious mythology, Satan is the source of the world's evils. Originally one of God's angels, he rebelled and caused Adam and Eve to fall to sin. He is also known as [[Lucifer (mythology)|]] in certain religious traditions. In traditional [[christian mythology|Christian]] theology, Satan is also the ruler of [[Hell]], tormenting unrepentant sinners for all eternity.

title: cobra_command
body:
Fictional [[terrorist]] organization from the [[G.I. Joe]] series. They are the main antagonists in the original comics and animated TV show.

[b][i]Cobra Command[/i][/b], also known simply as [i][b]Cobra[/b][/i], is an evil and sinister paramilitary organization which seeks to take over the Free World through [[terrorism]] and using exotic, advanced and sophisticated weaponry and experimental combat vehicles.

Cobra is under the leadership of [[Cobra Commander]], its original founder and creator. [[Destro]] is its main weapons and ordinance supplier.

title: g.i._joe
body:
[b][i]G.I. Joe[/i][/b] is a famous and classic line of [[military]] [[action figure]]s produced and owned by the [[Hasbro]] American toy company. 

"G.I." ([i]Government Issue[/i]) is a generic term for U.S. soldiers. The development of the first G.I. Joe toy led to the coining of the term "action figure". G.I. Joe's appeal to children has made it an American icon among toys. The action figure line has also become famous in many different countries across the rest of the world.

The G.I. Joe trademark has been used by Hasbro to title two different toy lines. 

The original 12-inch (30 cm) line that began in 1964 centered on realistic action figures. In the United Kingdom, this line was licensed to Palitoy and known as [i]Action Man[/i]. 

The initial product offering represented four of the branches of the U.S. armed forces with the Action Soldier (U.S. Army), Action Sailor (U.S. Navy), Action Pilot (USAF), Action Marine (USMC) and later on, the Action Nurse. 

Then in 1982, the line was relaunched in a much smaller 3.75-inch (9.5 cm) scale complete with new futuristic vehicles, detailed playsets, and a complex and rich background story involving an ongoing struggle between the [i]G.I. Joe [/i] team and the evil [[Cobra Command]] organization which seeks to take over the Free World through [[terrorism]] and using advanced and sophisticated weaponry. 

The new 80s line was initially intended as a means to sell the new toy vehicles, but over time the unique characters and their different and detailed action figures became much more popular and extremely sought after to this day.

The 1982 toy line became extremely successful and was also supported by two animated series as well as a major [[comic]] series published initially by [[Marvel]] Comics which expanded each character's background and mythos which were mostly developed by Marvel writer/artist "Larry Hama":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Larry_Hama .

body:
A character from the [[G.I. Joe]] toy line, comic books, cartoon and live action film series. 

[b]Storm Shadow[/b] is best known as [[Cobra Commander]]'s extremely lethal white [[ninja]] bodyguard. 

Storm Shadow is one of the most prominent characters in the [i]G.I. Joe: A Real American Hero[/i] franchise, and has appeared in every series since its inception. 

He is portrayed by "Lee Byung-hun":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lee_Byung-hun in the 2009 live-action film [i] "G.I. title: karakai_jouzu_no_takagi-san
body:
A 2013 to 2023 manga series written by [[Yamamoto Souichirou]]. It was first published as a one shot in Gekkan Shonen Sunday in June 2012 and then serialized in Gessan Mini since June 2013. An anime adaptation was produced by Shin-Ei Animation and aired during the Winter 2018 season, with a season 2 adaptation following during the Summer 2019 season. A third season followed, airing during the Winter 2022 season.

The series follows [[Nishikata]], a middle school student who is teased by his classmate [[Takagi-san]], and his efforts to try and make a successful comeback--to cause Takagi to blush from embarrassment.

There are also 4 manga spin-offs based on side characters and future events.
* [[Karakai Jouzu no (Moto) Takagi-san]] [spoiler]is about an older Nishikata and Takagi who are married and have a child named Chii.[/spoiler]
* [[Karakai Jouzu (?) no Nishikata-san]] [spoilers]is about the everyday stories of Chii, now the same age as Nishikata and Takagi in the first manga, as she tries to be just like her mother to another male classmate to mixed results.[/spoiler]

title: thermos
body:
A container or vessel designed to keep liquids hot or cold for long periods of time.  This is accomplished by the container being composed of two flasks, one within the other, and joined at the neck. The gap between the two flasks is partially evacuated of air to produce a near vacuum which helps to impede the transfer of heat between the contents and the outside.  

While these are known as a vacuum flask or vacuum bottle, these should not be confused with a Büchner flask used in laboratory vacuum filtration, which are also known as a vacuum flask.

h4. See also 

* [[Bottle]]

* [[Sports bottle]]

body:
The 4th/New Years [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Murasaki Shion]], for the original and 2022 versions respectively.

It consists of a [[fur scarf]] held by a [[pentagram]] accessory pin, a [[short kimono|short]] [[purple kimono|purple]] [[print kimono]] with [[frilled sleeves]] worn over her default outfit skirt, a pink [[obi]] and a larger inner black obi, a[[black pantyhose]], a [[thighlet]] on her left leg, and [[black footwear|black]] [[fur-trimmed boots]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this outfit is a [[side bun]] decorated with a [[hair flower|flower]] [[flower knot|knot]] [[kanzashi]] with [[tassel hair ornament|tassels]], a [[metal hairband|metal]] [[hairband]] and a [[kagami mochi]] [[mochi hair ornament|ornament]] on top of her regular triangle ornaments. The 2022 version changed the pattern on her hairband, removed the mochi ornament and changed the color of her kanzashi form orange to purple.

title: battle_angel_alita
body:
A [[science fiction]] and [[cyberpunk]] manga series created by [[Kishiro Yukito]] in 1990. Known in Japan as [i]Gunnm[/i] (銃夢, pronounced [i]Ganmu[/i], meaning "Gun Dream"), and in the west as [i]Battle Angel Alita[/i].

The series tells the story of [[Alita]], an amnesiac female [[cyborg]] found by cybermedic expert [[Ido Daisuke]], who repaired her body and also gave her her name.

The rebuilt Alita soon discovers that she possesses instinctive knowledge of the legendary martial art Panzer Kunst. She must learn to navigate, exist, and fight in the Scrapyard, whose inhabitants themselves live in the shadow of the tantalizingly close floating city, Salem. Her journeys take her across the Scrapyard and surrounding areas, as she tries to recall more of her past.

The manga was later made into a 2019 live action movie called [[Alita: Battle Angel]].

h4. Characters

* [[Alita]]
* [[Ido Daisuke]]
* [[Zafal Takie]]
* [[Desty Nova]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Battle Angel Alita":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_Angel_Alita

title: usada_pekora_(prisoner)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Usada Pekora]]. It was revealed on April Fools 2021, and is based on the running gag of her being often referred as a "war criminal" due to the cruel exploits and human experiments she runs on NPCs in Minecraft, and her constant pranks on other hololive members.

It is essentially [[prison clothes]], consisting of a [[black headwear|black]] and [[white headwear|white]] [[striped headwear|striped]] hat covering her ears, a [[metal collar]], and a [[long shirt|long]] [[torn shirt|torn]] [[striped shirt]]. Don-chan is now wrapped around her right leg and holds on to a large carrot-shaped a [[ball and chain restraint]]. She also wears [[no pants]] and is [[barefoot]] with this outfit.

Fitting with the prisoner aesthetic, her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this outfit is [[messy hair]] with her [[twin braids]] partially undone.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4445290: Profile

body:
Character in the [[Rance (series)|]] series, introduced in [[Kichikuou Rance]] and returns in [[Rance VI]] as a major antagonist.

A former [[Angel]], La Seizel is a Dark Lord affiliated with the [[Kayblis|]] Faction, and the twin sister of [[La Hawzel]], who is affiliated with the [[Hornet (rance)|]] Faction. Unlike her calm, compassionate sister, Seizel is volatile, selfish, and harbors a deep hatred of her sister, merely joining the Kayblis Faction because Hawzel joined the Hornet Faction.
