title: source_filmmaker_(medium)
body:
[b]Source Filmmaker[/b] (often abbreviated as [b]SFM[/b]) is a video capture and editing application developed by [[Valve Software]] for use within the Source game engine.

Source Filmmaker was initially used as an internal tool for the development of animated shorts. Some of the earliest examples are the "release trailer":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D8jQJ5SFqBU for Day of Defeat and the "Meet the Heavy":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jHgZh4GV9G0 short for [[Team Fortress 2]].

Source Filmmaker has been in open beta as of July 11, 2012, and is available for free through [[Steam (platform)|]], where uses can import custom models and maps compatible with the Source engine and use them in their own animations.

h4. See also

* [[3d]]
* [[video]]

h4. External links

* "Official Website":http://www.sourcefilmmaker.com/
* "Steam store page":http://store.steampowered.com/app/1840/
* "Wikipedia: Source Filmmaker":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Source_Filmmaker
* "Wikipedia: Source (game engine)":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Source_%28game_engine%29

title: alvida_(one_piece)
body:
[[One Piece]] character. Former captain of the Alvida Pirates, now allied with [[Buggy the Clown]]. She sees herself as the most beautiful lady in the world.

Having consumed the Sube Sube no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], her skin can become slick and friction-less. 

[spoiler]Before consuming said fruit, she was [[obese]]. Despite this, she still saw herself as the most beautiful, smashing anyone who disagreed with her iron mace.[/spoiler]

title: donquixote_doflamingo
body:
[[One Piece]] character. The captain of the [[donquixote_family|Donquixote Pirates]]. King of Dressrosa and one of the [[Shichibukai]].

He is the son [[Donquixote Homing]] and the older brother of [[Donquixote Rocinante]], [spoiler]both of whom he killed out of feeling betrayed by them.[/spoiler]

Having consumed the Ito Ito no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], he can create strings to cut or pull things.

[spoiler]Former Celestial Dragon, descended from the Donquixote Family. After being defeated by both [[Monkey D. Luffy]] and [[Trafalgar Law]], his position as a Warlord was revoked and he was imprisoned at [[Impel Down]]'s Level 6 for abusing his privilege and ruling the kingdom of Dressrosa with an iron fist.[/spoiler]
other_names: ドンキホーテ・ドフラミンゴ

title: gol_d._roger
body:
Prominent background character from [[One Piece]]. The legendary "King of the Pirates" and the previous owner of the "One Piece", the eponymous treasure of the series. 

As he was suffering from an incurable disease, Roger disbanded his own pirate crew and surrendered himself to the World Government. In his hometown where he was about to be executed, he urged the spectators to find the "One Piece" and other treasures collected during his lifetime, thus starting the Golden Age of Pirates.

[spoiler]He was the lover of [[Portgas D. Rouge]] and father of [[Portgas D. Ace]].[/spoiler]

title: shichibukai
body:
The [b]Seven Warlords of the Sea[/b] (王下七武海, Ōka Shichibukai) are a group of seven pirates allied with the World Government in [[One Piece]]. The roster has fluctuated as the story has progressed, but there's never more than seven at the same time.

However as a result of both Sir [[Crocodile (one piece)|]] enacting Operation Utopia in Arabasta and [[Donquixote Doflamingo]] becoming the tyrannical ruler of Dressrosa, the system was eventually disbanded.

h4.Members (as of the disbandment)
* [[Bartholomew Kuma]]
* [[Boa Hancock]]
* [[Buggy the Clown]]
* [[Dracule Mihawk]]
* [[Edward Weevil]]

h4.Former Members
* [[Crocodile (one Piece)|]]
* [[Jinbe (one piece)|]]
* [[Marshall D. Teach]]
* [[Gecko Moria]]
* [[Trafalgar Law]]
* [[Donquixote Doflamingo]]

h4.Candidates
There have been other pirates who have been selected to become Shichibukai but did not receive membership for one reason or another.
* [[Portgas D. Ace]]

title: interspecies
body:
Sexual or romantic acts between members of different species (mostly between a human and a humanoid, but different species of humanoids are also acceptable). Examples include a [[furry]] character with a regular human, a human with a [[humanoid robot]] or sentient [[mecha]] (e.g. [[Transformers]] or [[Yuusha series]] robots), a human with a humanoid [[Pokemon (creature)|Pokemon]] such as a [[Machoke]], [[Hypno]], [[Gardevoir]], or a human with a [[monster|monstrous]] character such as a [[goblin]], an [[orc]], a [[Hilichurl (genshin impact)|]], or [[Bowser]].

Do not tag [[bestiality]] as interspecies; bestiality is for sex or romance with animals or beasts, interspecies is for sex or romance with humanoids.

h4. See also

title: ranma-chan
body:
The canonical genderswapped version of [[Saotome Ranma]]. In the series [[Ranma 1/2]], Ranma is cursed so that whenever he gets soaked with cold water he transforms into a girl. He's able to revert back to a man when soaked with hot water. 

In terms of appearance, she very closely resembles Ranma's male form, but has [[red hair]] as opposed to [[black hair]], is about a head height shorter, and of course has female primary and secondary characteristics ([[breasts]], body shape, etc).

Only tag as [[Saotome Ranma]] if her male form is also present. In situations where she appears alongside her original male self, the [[dual persona]] tag should be used.

Voiced by [[Hayashibara Megumi]].

title: molotov_cocktail
body:
An improvised [[fire|incendiary]] [[bomb]] made simply by filling a glass [[bottle]] with fuel or any flammable substance, sealing it with a piece of cloth and then [[burning|lighting]] the cloth on fire when used. The bottle is tossed at the target, which immediately is covered by the [[burning]] fuel after the bottle breaks upon contact.

It has been used in violent [[rioting|riot]]s, by different gangs and various non-state combatants different parts of the world.

Its common name comes from an insulting reference by Finnish soldiers (who used the "cocktail" to great effect during the Winter war, and later [[World War II]]) to [[Soviet]] foreign minister [[Vyacheslav Molotov]], who was responsible for the partition of [[Finland]] during [[Joseph Stalin]]'s regime. At one point, Molotov claimed that the bombing campaign during the Winter war was a "humanitarian operation", which spawned sarcastic remarks among the Finnish population referring to the Soviet bombs as "Molotov's basket". Molotov himself, obviously, highly disliked the name.

h4. See also
* [[flamethrower]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

title: carrie_kelley
body: Caroline Keene "Carrie" Kelley is a superheroine from Frank Miller's graphic novels The Dark Knight Returns (1986) and its sequels The Dark Knight Strikes Again (2001–2002) and The Dark Knight III: The Master Race (2015–2017). She becomes the new [[Robin (dc)|]] in The Dark Knight Returns when she saves [[batman|Batman's]] life. Later in The Dark Knight Strikes Again, she adopts the identity Catgirl, and in The Dark Knight III: The Master Race, she adopts the identity [[Batwoman]]. She was the first full-time female Robin in the history of the [[batman (series)|Batman franchise]], though Julie Madison had passed off as Robin for a brief time in a Bob Kane story published in Detective Comics #49 in March 1941.

title: bismarck_zwei_(azur_lane)
body: The second, Ultra Rare-rarity, personification of [[Bismarck (Azur Lane)|]] in [i][[Azur Lane]][/i]. Not to be confused with the original although it is specified that Bismarck [i]Zwei[/i] is the same body and memories but carrying more animalistic equipment in line with prevailing Iron Blood faction aesthetics. Voiced by [[Fukuhara Ayaka|]]. h4. Appearance [tn]See post #6321226.[/tn] She is still portrayed with the same [[blue eyes]] and [[long_hair|long]] [[blonde hair]]. Her outfit still consists of a black [[military uniform]] with German flag accents on her dress with [[double-breasted]] [[buttons]], while her [[peaked cap]] retains the [[Reichsadler|Parteiadler]] ornament. She still wears the same [[fur_trim|fur-trimmed]] [[cape]] but her original [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots]] are turned into black [[armored boots]]. Her [[Bismarck (coat of arms)|coat-of-arms]] is now displayed on her right shoulder and she loses the German flag. Her [[rigging]] turns into a massive animalistic style (in the form of an automaton named "Geryon") in line with the Iron Blood faction, still sporting her four 38 cm twin gun mounts and 150 mm twin gun mounts plus some 105 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun]]s on the sides. h4. title: the_end_(minecraft)
body:
A dimension found in the game [[Minecraft]].

The End is a barren, empty dimensional plane containing a large floating island of a unique material called End Stone, dotted with Obsidian pillars. This dimension is populated by a vast number of [[enderman|Endermen]], who spawn considerably more often than in the Overworld, and one [[Ender Dragon]], an End-exclusive mob. 

(Taken from "the Minecraft wiki":http://www.minecraftwiki.net/wiki/The_End)

title: zaku_cannon
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]MS-06K Zaku Cannon[/b]

A long range artillery support [[Zeon]] [[mobile_Suit|MS]] built upon the frame of the venerable [[Zaku II]]. It possessed a 180mm gun mounted upon its backpack and slung over its left shoulder, rooughly equivalent to the ones on the [[Guntank]] and able to destroy enemy MS in a single well placed shot. 

Some units were equipped with the "Big Gun" missile launchers, fired from the waist, and sported twin [[radio antenna]]e on the head - those units were called "Rabbit Types".

title: moral_orel
body: Moral Orel is an American adult stop-motion animated black comedy drama series created by Dino Stamatopoulos which originally aired on [[cartoon network|Cartoon Network's]] nighttime programming block [[Adult Swim]] from December 13, 2005 to December 18, 2008. The series follows the titular [[Orel Puppington]], a young, happy-go-lucky and naïve Protestant who showcases his commitment to God, while dealing with the cynicism of his abusive and alcoholic father, his lethargic mother, and the devoutly Protestant town of Moralton in which he resides.

title: villainous
body: Villainous (Spanish: Villanos) is a Mexican-American animated television and web series produced by A.I. Animation Studios for [[Cartoon Network]] and Max. It was created by Alan Ituriel, a veteran of the animation industry in [[Mexico]]. It is based on a 2012 web series of the same name which Ituriel had previously created and was initially picked up by Cartoon Network Latin America as a miniseries of ten one-minute episodes for the Cartoon Network Anything app (further episodes, along with a series of specials, were released later). The series is co-produced by Cartoon Network (through its Latin America Original Production unit) and A.I. Animation Studios. The series has since expanded onto a media franchise consistent of books and tie-ins.

title: dexter's_laboratory
body: Dexter's Laboratory is an American animated television series created by Genndy Tartakovsky for [[Cartoon Network]] and the first original series for the channel under the Cartoon Cartoons moniker. The series follows Dexter, an enthusiastic boy-genius with a hidden science laboratory in his room, which he keeps secret from his unsuspecting parents. Dexter is at constant odds with his older and more extraverted sister [[Dee Dee]], who regularly accesses the laboratory and inadvertently foils his experiments. [[Mandark]], a nefarious boy-genius classmate who lives next-door to Dexter, attempts to undermine him at every opportunity. Prominently featured in the first and second seasons are other segments focusing on superhero-based characters Monkey, Dexter's pet lab-monkey with a superhero alter ego, and the Justice Friends, a trio of superheroes who share an apartment.

title: batman:_the_brave_and_the_bold
body: Batman: The Brave and the Bold is an American animated television series based in part on the [[DC Comics]] series The Brave and the Bold which features two or more superheroes coming together to solve a crime or foil a super villain. As the title suggests, the series focuses on Batman's regular "team-ups" with various heroes similar to the most well-known version of the original comic book series. This version has a much lighter and simpler, often comic feel, targeting younger viewers more than the character's other series. The series premiered on November 14, 2008, on [[Cartoon Network]] in the United States, and ended on November 18, 2011. It also aired in Canada on Teletoon. The series was followed by a comic-book continuation which ended in 2014, and a feature-length crossover film: Scooby-Doo! & Batman: The Brave and the Bold, which aired in 2018.

title: tec-9
body:
A high capacity Swedish [[gun|pistol]] manufactured by Intratec.

There are several varations of the pistol. The TEC-DC9 was made to circumvent a California ban, and featured the slings moved to the back of the gun.

During Clinton's assault weapon ban, the AB-10 was introduced, a TEC-9 without a threaded muzzle barrel and with a 10-round magazine instead of the trademark 20 or 32 round magazines.

It is infamously pictured with many mass murderers, including the Columbine killers.

title: bomber_jacket
body:
A short sturdy [[jacket]] traditionally made of [[leather jacket|leather]] and having a fitted or elastic waist, a zippered or buttoned front, and often a fleece, pile or fur collar. Also called flight jacket.

Modern bomber jackets tend to be of fabric rather than leather and may be used as sports clothes. Bomber jackets are often styled into [[letterman jacket]]s, with added details common for that style of jacket. But, the fundamental construction of the garment is very similar.

h4. Examples

h6.Traditional bomber jacket

* !post #6600576: Traditional [[leather jacket]] with a flat collar.
* !post #7000731: Traditional [[leather jacket]] with a fur collar.

h6. Modern bomber jacket

* !post #1038978: Two modern bomber jackets with stand-up stretch collars. 
* !post #4934732: Modern [[cropped jacket|cropped bomber jacket]].

title: blinky_(the_simpsons)
body: Blinky the Three-Eyed Fish (or simply Blinky) is a three-eyed orange [[fish]] species in [[The Simpsons]], found in the ponds and lakes outside the nuclear power plant. The Springfield Nuclear Power Plant caused the mutations.

title: dj_yellow
body:
[i][[Rhythm Tengoku]][/i] character. Only appears in the [i][[Rhythm Tengoku Gold]][/i] minigame "DJ School".

An excitable, peppy yellow humanoid who teaches his [[student (rhythm tengoku)|Student]]. Is not actually a professional DJ, as his classes are supposed to teach people how to look like one.

title: dragonlord_placidusax
body:
[b]Dragonlord Placidusax[/b] is a boss in [[Elden Ring]]. He gigantic multiheaded Ancient Dragon, although a few of his heads are missing from previous battles. His body is stony and battered, showing many wounds from his past. In a past age, Placidusax had the title of Elden Lord. This boss spews golden fire and summon red lightning, and has the ability to teleport.

[spoiler]Placidusax is found in the secret timeless arena hidden below Crumbling Farum Azula.[/spoiler]

title: hoarah_loux
body:
[b]Hoara Loux[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. He is one of the notable [[Tarnished (elden ring)|]] mentioned during the introduction of the game.

[spoilers]After becoming Elden Lord, Hoarah Loux changed his name to [[godfrey first elden lord|Godfrey]].
other_names: 蛮地の王ホーラ・ルー

title: serosh_(elden_ring)
body:
[b]Serosh[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. He is the beast regent of [[godfrey first elden lord|Godfrey, the First Elden Lord]], and serves to hold his rage at bay.

[spoiler]Serosh is killed by Godfrey as he changes to his true form, [[Hoarah Loux]], unleashing his suppressed rage.[/spoiler]

title: lichdragon_fortissax
body:
[b]Lichdragon Fortissax[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. He is a [[western dragon|winged]] [[dragon]] that can conjure and wield [[lightning]].

Fortissax is the [[brother and sister|brother]] of [[Ancient Dragon Lansseax|Lansseax]] and was a good friend of [[Godwyn the Golden]].

[spoilers]Fortissax is a secret, optional boss faced in the final phase of [[fia the deathbed companion|Fia's]] quest, that is nonetheless important to the main story.

title: maliketh_the_black_blade
body:
[b]Maliketh, the Black Blade[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. He is [spoilers]the shadow of [[Queen Marika the Eternal]].

[spoilers]Maliketh disguises himself as [[gurranq beast clergyman|Gurranq]] for much of the game.[/spoilers]

title: fire_giant_(elden_ring)
body:
[b]The Fire Giant[/b] is a major boss in [[Elden Ring]]. He is found at the Mountaintop of the Giants, next to the Forge of the Giants. The Fire Giant is the last of his kind, having his kind wiped out by [[Godfrey First Elden Lord]] and his army of [[Crucible Knight]]s long before the time of the game. 

This hundred-feet plus tall monster carries a large lid above its head and uses it as his weapon, along with various fire-spewing abilities.

title: rykard_lord_of_blasphemy
body:

This is [spoilers]the form that Rykard took after being devoured by the [[God-Devouring Serpent]].[/spoilers]

h4. See also
* [[Praetor Rykard]]
other_names: 冒涜の君主ライカード

title: praetor_rykard
body:
[b]Praetor Rykard[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. He is one of [[rennala queen of the full moon|Rennala's]] and [[radagon of the golden order|Radagon's]] [[family|sons]] and brother to both [[starscourge radahn|Radahn]] and [[lunar princess ranni|Ranni]]. While he is often depicted with [[red hair]] [spoilers]before his transformation[/spoilers] in fan art, a portrait in his home depicts him with [[blonde hair]].

[spoilers]This was [[rykard lord of blasphemy|Rykard's]] demi-god form before he was devoured by the [[God-Devouring Serpent]]

title: ishima_kaigen
body:
石馬戒厳 ([i]Ishima Kaigen[/i]) is an eighty-two year old [[soldier]] who appears in the [[eroge]] "[[Hanachirasu]]" made by Nitro+ ([[NitroPlus]]). Ishima has the appearance of a small girl with [[long hair|long]], [[black hair]], wearing an [[Imperial Japanese Army]] [[military uniform]] and she fights with a [[katana]].
Ishima is a parody of "[i]Katou Yasunori[/i]":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yasunori_Kat%C5%8D , appearing as an antagonist in "Aramata Hiroshi":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hiroshi_Aramata 's "[i]Teito Monogatari[/i]":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teito_Monogatari .
The voice actress for Ishima is "Hokuto Minami":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%8C%97%E9%83%BD%E5%8D%97 , a very famous [[eroge]] voice actress.
Ishima Kaigen appeared later in the Nitro+ 2-D fighting game called "[[Nitro+Royale]]: Heroines Duel". At Ishima's end of the game, or rather her ending itself, is a [[voice actor connection]].

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article 'Hanachirasu'":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hanachirasu
* "Hanachirasu Official site":http://www.nitroplus.co.jp/sp/
* "Nitro+Royale: Heroines Duel Official site":http://www.nitroplus.co.jp/pc/lineup/into_14/

body:

At some point in August 2024, NEXAS removed Noah’s  profile on their website. No expanation was made until the 23rd of the same month and year when he would make an "announcement":[https://x.com/NoahNEXAS/status/1826835291153600598] on his Twitter account saying that he would be graduating from NEXAS and would be stepping away from VTubing in the future.

He has [[brown hair]]. [[black-framed eyewear|black-framed]] [[glasses]] and [[green eyes]].

His outfit consists of a [[white shirt]], a [[red hoodie]], a [[brown apron]] with [[pin|pins]], [[black pants]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]]. He is holding a [[ferret]] in one of his hands.

title: demon_horns
body:
The [[horns]] of a [[demon girl]], or [[demon boy]].

They come in two broad varieties:
* short and stubby with an upward/inward curve, as in the emoticon: 😈 Common in simple illustrations and comedy. Similar to [[cow horns]].
* long with elaborate [[curled horns|curvature]]. Common in complex illustrations. Frequently resemble [[sheep horns|sheep]] or [[goat horns]], including a bumpy, textured surface. Alternately, they may appear smooth and metallic.

In both versions, the horns are usually attached to the sides or top of the head. This is in contrast to [[skin-covered horns]], which are usually attached to the forehead.

title: hospital_rokunin_no_ishi
body:
Japanese title: "HOSPITAL. 6人の医師" ("HOSPITAL Roku-nin no Ishi", "Hospital: 6 Doctors")

Trauma Team is a video game for the Wii console. The game is part of the [[Chou Shittou Caduceus|Trauma Center]] series by Atlus. 

Different from the previous games of the series, where players only took part on surgeries, this new entry allows a wider range of medical procedures which include First Response, Diagnosis, Endoscopy, Orthopedics, and Forensics.

h4. Protagonists

* [[CR-S01]] - General Surgeon
* [[Gabriel Cunningham]] - Diagnostician
* [[Hank Freebird]] - Orthopedic Surgeon
* [[Maria Torres]] - Paramedic
* [[Mira Kimishima]] - Medical Forensics Expert
* [[Tomoe Tachibana]] - Endoscopist

h6. Other Characters

* [[Albert Sartre]]
* [[Alyssa Breslin]]
* [[Claire Blunt]]
* [[Darnell Sellers]]
* [[Emma Wilson]]
* [[Esha Patel]]
* [[Navel (hospital rokunin no ishi)|Navel]]
* [[Rosalia Rosselini]]

h4.See also

title: beck_(mighty_no._9)
body:
Main protagonist of [i][[Mighty No. 9]][/i], and a spiritual analogue to [[Mega Man (character)|]].

He is the latest creation of [[William White|Professor William White]] and 9th line of the Mighty Numbers. He posses abilities similar to his spiritual predecessor, however he also has the ability to "AcXelerate", which allows him dash quickly around his environment similarly to [[Mega Man X (series)|]] and can be used to not only quickly defeat most weakened enemies, but also gain power-ups from them as well. He also has the ability of "ReXelection", where Beck transforms his body to harness abilities gained from the Mighty Numbers. Like X, Beck has human-like emotions and the ability to think freely, as well as kind-hearted personality, however he has self-doubts about his abilities and being able to live up to his family's reputation.

[spoiler]Beck is also the third attempt of Professor White's ongoing experiments of creating an freely-evolving robot that can manipulate and assimilate Xels, the others being [[ray_(mighty_no._9)|Ray]] and [[trinity_(mighty_no._9)|Trinity]], both of whom ended up with disastrous results, however Beck was the only one that functioned properly.[/spoiler]

Prior to [i]Mighty No. 9[/i], Beck made an early appearance in [i][[Mighty Gunvolt]][/i], a retro-inspired run-and-gun game also produced by Inti Creates alongside [[Gunvolt]] from [i]Azure Striker Gunvolt[/i] and [[ekoro (galgun)|Ekoro]] from [i]Gal☆Gun[/i], as well as its sequel, [i][[Mighty Gunvolt Burst]][/i].

title: u-wing
body: The UT-60D (also known as the U-Wing) is a Rebel transport/gunship that appears in the [[Star Wars]] film [[Rogue One: a Star wars story|Rogue One]]. Used by the Rebel Alliance, these ships are used to drop troops into battle, and provide cover fire for them. U-Wings feature at least one side door which could also be used as a viewport for a mounted blaster cannon. Depending on the situation, the U-Wing's retractable wings could be positioned forward-facing or backward-facing.

title: birdie_the_early_bird
body:
Birdie the Early Bird is the first identifiable female character used in [[McDonald's]] McDonaldland commercials introduced in 1980 to promote the company's new breakfast items. She is a yellow [[bird]] wearing a pink jumpsuit, flight cap and scarf. In the ads she is frequently portrayed as a poor flyer and somewhat clumsy in general.

Birdie was voiced by the late Russi Taylor (voice of [[Minnie Mouse]]) and portrayed by Patti Maloney in the McDonald's television commercials and is voiced by Christine Cavanaugh in The Wacky Adventures of [[Ronald McDonald]].

title: mr._poopybutthole
body:
Wayne Poopybutthole, more commonly referred to as Mr. Poopybutthole and formerly Professor Poopybutthole, is a long-time family friend of the Smith Family and a recurring character in [[Rick and Morty]]
He is mostly shown breaking the fourth wall during the show and is the only other character to do this besides Rick. Mr. Poopybutthole often addresses the audience in post-credit scenes following a season finale, where he talks about what just happened in the episode as well as his personal life, before encouraging the audience to tune in for the next season.

title: call_(mighty_no._9)
body:
Character in [i][[Mighty No. 9]][/i].  Analogous to [[Roll (mega man)|]]. 

The official design was chosen by online voting amongst the nine candidates seen here"[1]":[#dtext-external-links]. After a close-run vote, [[Call F]] was chosen as the final design.

h4. Designs

* [[Call A]] - [[glasses]], robotic [[twintails]], [[striped sleeves]].
* [[Call B]] - [[over-rim eyewear|over-rim glasses]], [[bangs]], [[hat]].
* [[Call C]] - [[high ponytail]], [[headphones]], [[sailor collar]]
* [[Call D]] - [[twintails]], [[headphones]], [[robot joints]]. Design by [[Inafune Keiji]].
* [[Call E]] - [[side ponytail]], [[two-tone hair]], [[garrison cap]], [[headset]]. Design by [[Ishikawa Hideki]].
* [[Call F]] - [[ponytail]], [[headphones]], [[striped sleeves]], [[knee boots]]. Design by [[Natsume Yuuji]].
* [[Call G]] - [[side ponytail]], [[glasses]], [[dress]].
* [[Call H]] - [[robot ears]], [[twintails]], [[detached sleeves]], [[neckerchief]]. Design by [[Komaki Shinsuke]].
* [[Call I]] - [[twin braids]], [[under-rim eyewear|under-rim]] [[glasses]], [[beret]].

h4. Vote results

h6. First round
In the "first round":https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/mightyno9/mighty-no-9/posts/611851, there was an online poll open to everyone. Voters were allowed to cast a single vote for their favorite Call. The poll ran from September 27 to October 1, 2013, the end of the Mighty No. 9 Kickstarter. The top three vote getters would then move onto a second round.

The vote results were announced during a livestream "here":http://www.twitch.tv/comceptusa/c/3019760 at around 2:15:00. 

The results were also recapped in the Kickstarter post "here":https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/mightyno9/mighty-no-9/posts/615035. Of the over 82,000 votes, the finalists had the following vote shares:

* Call H - 10.12%
* Call E - 24.09% 
* Call F - 35.31%


After announcing the results during the livestream, they also talked about other Call designs. This included Inafune's Call D. 
* (At 2:20:50) Host: One thing that a lot of people pointed out was this hairstyle looks like a certain bad, other villain from a previous game series and might have had a bad association with some people.
* (Translator conveying this to Inafune)
* Inafune: (laughs) Dr. Wilyという！
* Another Translator (Mighty No. 069):  He's saying, "Just shut up and say 'Dr. Wily'!"
* Host: I was trying to be tactful about it.
* Mighty No. 069: "Shut up and say, 'Dr. Wily!'"
* Host: Was that on purpose or was that...
* Inafune: Dr. Wilyを出さないじゃん。Dr. Wilyを出すべきだと思って、あの、一応silhouetteになった、Dr. Wilyになるから
* Mighty No. 069: So, ultimately I was thinking that, you know, there was no Dr. Wily in the game, but there should be somebody that carries the torch, that carries on the torch for Dr. Wily, so, you know, I figured that I couldn't really use Dr. Wily. However, the silhouette looks somewhat similar so that's kind of a way to...
* Inafune: <some Japanese>
* Mighty No. 069: So probably the high-level people, the high-level people with true art taste, would be able to look at this and know that this truly is the best design. The other people probably just chose F, the ones that didn't know. He's joking folks, he's joking.
 
h6. Second round

In the second round, voting was restricted to online backers. The results were announced "here":https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/mightyno9/mighty-no-9/posts/706604.
* Call H - 15.47%
* Call E - 41.14%
* Call F - 43.39%  (Overall winner)

h4#external-links. External Links

* [1] http://www.kickstarter.com/projects/mightyno9/mighty-no-9/posts/611851

title: matoba_risa
body:
An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Passion (Yellow Sun) category. Risa is a demanding young girl who absolutely loves her Daddy. It seems her father gives her anything she wants, and she seems to have a cheetah or tiger motif. She usually wears prints of these animals in her clothes. Unlike the vast majority of idols in the series, she sees the Producer as the second most important man in her life: Daddy always comes first and foremost.

She is voiced by [[Tamegai Hana]].

title: hirabitai
body:
A [b]hirabitai[/b] is a type of women's traditional Japanese [[hair ornament]] from the [[Heian]] period. It is a flat golden piece with three prongs pointing upwards, secured with a comb and hairpins ([i]kushi[/i] and [i]saishi[/i]). Often seen on characters wearing [[karaginu mo]] ([[layered kimono]]) or on the "mebina" [[hina ningyou|doll]] of [[Hinamatsuri]].

title: kaneki_ken
body:
Main character in [i][[Tokyo Ghoul]][/i]. He also appears in [[Tokyo Ghoul:re]]. [spoilers]First he is shown as [[Sasaki Haise]] after a timeskip, but later becomes Ken Kaneki again.[/spoilers]
In the first season he´s shown with [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]], but suffers from Marie Antoinette Syndrom and gets [[white hair]] instead. He becomes a ghoul in the first season due to an operation, where he gets the [[Kagune (tokyo ghoul)|]] from [[Kamishiro Rize]]. While he´s not a true ghoul, he is called an one-eyed ghoul, because only his left eye turns [[red eyes|red]] with complete [[black sclera]]. This is the reason why he wears an [[eyepatch]].

[Spoiler]In the last season he marries [[Kirishima Touka]] with whom he has a child, [[Kaneki Ichika]].[/spoiler]

body:
The sequel to [[Ace Attorney Investigations: Miles Edgeworth]], with the player taking the role of [[Miles Edgeworth]] once again. This was the only game in the [i]Ace Attorney[/i] franchise to not have an official translation until the release of Ace Attorney Investigations Collection on September 6, 2024. There is a fan translation that filled the gap in the meantime.

title: shell_(company)
body: Commonly known as Shell, a Dutch–British multinational oil and gas company headquartered in The Hague, Netherlands and with its registered office in London, United Kingdom. It is the world's second largest company by 2011 revenues and one of the six oil and gas "supermajors". Shell is also one of the world's most valuable companies. As of September 2012, its largest shareholder is BlackRock with 5% stake, while the Qatar Investment Authority has announced a plan to raise its stake from below 3% to 7%.

title: cristina_hernandez
body:
Helga Cristina Hernández Ramírez (Mexico City, February 13, 1977), known as Cristina Hernández, is a [[mexico|Mexican]] dubbing actress, dubbing director, astrologer and voice-over artist.
She is recognized for having given her voice to main characters in several anime series such as [[Kinomoto Sakura]], protagonist of [[Cardcaptor Sakura]], [[lime (saber j)|Lime]] in the [[saber Marionette j|Saber Marionette]] franchise, [[Minamoto Shizuka]] in [[Doraemon]], [[Chibi usa]] / [[Sailor Chibi Moon]] in the [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]] franchise, [[Tailmon]], [[Yagami Hikari]] and [[Angewomon]] in various [[Digimon]] projects and [[marron (dragon_ball)|Marron]] in [[Dragon Ball Z]] and [[Dragon Ball GT]]. She also voices [[Padme Amidala]] in the [[Star Wars]] franchise.

title: mushibugyou
body:
[b]Mushibugyou[/b] is a shounen manga series written & illustrated by [[Fukuda Hiroshi]]. The series was originally serialized in Shogakukan's, [i]Shōnen Sunday Super,[/i] from August 2009 to September 2010. A second series, [b]Jōjū Senjin!! Mushibugyō[/b], a retelling of the original series, was serialized in [i]Weekly Shōnen Sunday[/i], from January 2011 to September 2017.

There is a 2013 anime adaptation by [[Seven Arcs]].

title: haori
body:
A lightweight silk jacket worn over a [[kimono]]. Mostly worn by men, this jacket is at hip- or thigh-length.
There may be a decorative tie string called [[haori himo]] across the chest or the middle of the jacket.

[[Shinsengumi]] are identified by a light blue haori, with sleeves trimmed with white dandara-moyou (mountain stripes).

Not to be confused with [[kataginu]], which more resembles a vest than a traditional jacket. 

Often confused with [[happi]], which has tube-sleeves, instead of kimono sleeves. 

h4. Related

title: happi
body:
A traditional Japanese tube/straight-sleeved [[jacket]] worn during [[festival]]s. Has a thick border (usually black in color) running down the coat opening, with the jacket length usually reaching between the hips and waist. The happi may be worn [[open clothes|open]] or fastened closed with the use of a cloth belt. The sleeves are usually on the shorter side, but can also reach the wrists.

Traditionally indigo or brown in color, though other colors exist.

For a type of traditional indoor winter jacket, use [[hanten (clothes)]].

A similar Japanese garment called [[haori]] has wider kimono-sleeves, and is typically of a heavier fabric. 

h4. Examples

title: fennec_shand
body: Fennec Shand is a fictional character in the [[Star Wars]] franchise portrayed by Ming-Na Wen in the Disney+ television series [[The Mandalorian]], The Bad Batch, and [[The Book of Boba Fett]]. An elite mercenary and assassin, she was introduced in "Chapter 5: The Gunslinger" of The Mandalorian, in which she is sought by the show's title character and another bounty hunter, Toro Calican, who seemingly kills her. "Chapter 14: The Tragedy" established that Fennec was saved by [[Boba Fett]], leaving her in his debt, and had parts of her body replaced with cybernetics. As Fett's new partner, she assists him in his mission to recover his old armor from the Mandalorian, and later to rescue Grogu to honor an agreement made with the latter. Once their mission is completed, the two conquer Tatooine and the remnants of the Hutt cartels. In The Book of Boba Fett, Fennec and Fett come into conflict with various enemies attempting to seize power from them, leading them to ally with the Mandalorian once more to defend their new crime empire.

title: b2_battle_droid
body: B2-series super battle droids,[ also known as B2 super battle droids, were an advanced battle droid used by the Confederacy of Independent Systems during the [[star wars: the clone wars|Clone Wars]]. Although one model of the B2-series was only equipped with wrist blasters on their right forearm, another was outfitted with wrist blasters on both forearms. Super battle droids were much stronger than their predecessors, and like the updated B1s used by the Confederacy, they did not require a command system to operate, which gave the droids limited independence. Another improvement was their thick armor casing, which contained their fragile sensors. However, B2s were designed with simple processors, limiting their ability to formulate strategies. As a result, they relied on organic commanders or tactical droids in order to effectively operate. The B2 was much stronger than the B1s, with enough strength to lift a clone trooper off the ground.

title: commander_wolffe
body: Character from [[Star Wars]], Wolffe, formerly designated CC-3636, was a veteran Clone Commander who served in the Grand Army of the Republic with Jedi General [[Plo Koon]] during the Clone Wars. The leader of the 104th Battalion's famed Wolfpack squad, Commander Wolffe proved to be tireless in his efforts against the Confederacy of Independent Systems, displaying an affinity for strategy. On his first mission with Koon, Wolffe served on board the Jedi Master's flagship, the Triumphant, when Koon led a task force to eliminate the Separatist warship Malevolence. While confronting the Malevolence in the Abregado system, all the troopers from the Wolfpack who were on board the ship were eliminated, save for Koon, Wolffe, Clone Sergeant Sinker, and trooper Boost. The four were rescued by Jedi General [[Anakin Skywalker]] and his Padawan, [[Ahsoka Tano]], and Wolffe had his unit adopt new clone trooper armor in honor of his fallen comrades. Refusing to let the loss of the Wolfpack deter him from his service, he inspired loyalty amongst his men.

[spoilers]Godfrey is the name taken up by [[Hoarah Loux]] after becoming Elden Lord.

title: ultraman:_the_ultimate_hero
body:
The 11th installment of the long-running [[Ultra Series]], and the last Ultraman series to be produced overseas, also known as "[i]Ultraman Powered[/i]" in Japan. Stars the titular [[Ultraman Powered]].

Much like [[Ultraman: Towards the Future]], this show is another international co-production, but between [[Tsuburaya Productions]], and Major Havoc Entertainment, a production company in the [[United States]], rather than [[Australia]]'s South Australian Film Corporation, in the former's case.

title: chaos_(warhammer)
body: The principal antagonists of the [[Warhammer Fantasy]] and [[warhammer_40k|Warhammer 40,000]] franchises. As the name suggests, they seek to break down order and will often fight themselves as much as they fight the organized factions opposing them. Chaos is centered around four principal deities, [[Tzeentch]] (god of change, plots, and knowledge), [[Khorne]] (god of bloodshed, violence, and rage), [[Nurgle]] (god of pestilence, decay, and despair), and [[Slaanesh]] (god of excess, decadence, and perfection). Each god has its own symbol, but Chaos as a whole is represented by an eight-pointed star with a circle running through it. Those who fall to Chaos are often subjected to insanity and mutation.

title: kim_yo-jong
body:
[b]Kim Yo-jong[/b] (b. September 26, 1987) is a [[north korea|North Korean]] political figure, and the younger sister of [[Kim Jong-un]], the third supreme leader of DPRK.

Became a subject of animefication after a rumor about her brother's illness and death in April 2020 and speculation about her becoming the first female supreme leader of DPRK.

title: hyakumonogatari
body:
[b][i]Hyakumonogatari Kaidankai[/i][/b]

Roughly translated: Gathering of 100 Ghost Stories

A game played at night where a hundred [[candle]]s are lit in a [[dark room]] and participants take turn telling ghost stories, extinguishing one candle after each story. The belief is that ghosts or the supernatural will be summoned after the 100th story is told and the last candle is extinguished, so participants usually leave the game incomplete.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article: Hyakumonogatari Kaidankai":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hyakumonogatari_Kaidankai]

title: north_korea
body:
Official name: Democratic People's Republic of Korea (DPRK)

A [[communism|communist]] country (though later claimed itself to be ruled with the distinct [i]juche[/i] ideology) who rules the northern half of the Korean peninsula lead by the Kim dynasty. Well known for its extreme isolationism and militarism, as well as its cult of personality. Its only ruling political party is the [[Workers' Party of Korea flag|Workers' Party of Korea]] (WPK).

h4. See also
* [[Korea]] (the overall culture of Korea in general)
* [[South Korea]] (the southen, democratic half of Korea)

title: brother_corhyn_(elden_ring)
body: [b]Brother Coryhn[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. He is first found within the Roundtable Hold, where he will sell you various beginner incantations. Giving him additional tomes will unlock more incantations for sale. Coyrhn is searching for of the mysterious [[Goldmask (elden ring)|]]. Letting him know the whereabouts of Goldmask will start his quest.

title: richelieu_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the historical French Navy battleship [i]Richelieu[/i]. 
Character design by [[Ask (askzy)]], voiced by [[Inoue Marina]].

She is the leader of the original Iris Orthodoxy faction and later the [[Iris Libre (Emblem)|]] faction that is based off the Free French. She is referred to as the "Cardinal" as a reference to her namesake, Cardinal Jean-Armand du Plessis, Duke of Richelieu. Consequently, she ends up with a very Christian personality.

She has [[blonde hair|blonde]] or [[orange hair|orange]] hair, [[purple eyes]], [[large breasts]] and she wears a [[short dress|short]] [[white dress]] with [[detached sleeves|detached]], [[striped sleeves|striped]], [[juliet sleeves]], and a [[red cape]]. She is also shown carrying a large [[French flag]] with the [[Free French flag|Cross of Lorraine]] in the middle, the symbol of the Free French.

Her [[rigging]] consists of her two historical 380 mm quad main gun mounts on white protective coverings, two 152 mm triple mounts on the sides of the main gun rigs, and a central section holding the two sides together that contains her bridge and [[radar|radars]].

h4. Skins

* !post #3919065: Default
* !post #3919070: [[Richelieu (Fleuron of the Waves) (Azur Lane)|Fleuron of the Waves]]
* !post #4444952: [[Richelieu (Evergreen Prophecy) (Azur Lane)|Evergreen Prophecy]]

title: scooby-doo_and_the_witch's_ghost
body:
Scooby-Doo! and the Witch's Ghost is a 1999 American direct-to-video animated supernatural horror comedy film, and the second of the direct-to-video films based upon [[Scooby-Doo]] Saturday morning cartoons. It was produced by Hanna-Barbera Cartoons and Warner Bros. Animation. The film was released on VHS on October 5, 1999, then on DVD on March 6, 2001.

Remembered mainly due to introducing the [[Hex Girls]], an all-female eco-goth rock band consisting of [[Thorn (scooby-doo)|]], [[Dusk (scooby-doo)|]], and [[Luna (scooby-doo)|]].

title: edd_gould
body:
A British animator, artist, and [[voice actor]]. He was best known for creating [[Eddsworld]], a media franchise consisting of flash animations and web comics featuring fictionalized versions of himself and longtime collaborators Thomas "[[TomSka]]" Ridgewell, Matt Hargreaves, Tord Larsson, among others.

He passed away on March 25th, 2012, following a six-year long battle with leukemia. His show, Eddsworld, continued on with other creators taking over his position as showrunner, such as the aforementioned TomSka, as well as Matt Hargreaves, who still runs the show to this day.

title: slit_pupils
body:
Pupils that are "non-circular" that appear to be stretched vertically or horizontally.

These style of eyes are commonly seen with animals like small felines, foxes, goats, lizards, snakes, and cephalopods. It is a common feature of fantasy creatures such as dragons, vampires, demons and other monster characters, as well.

[[Tsurime]] eyes sometimes have large irises with a pupil appearing slit, but this isn't sufficient to be actual "slit pupils". This is also distinct from [[|_|]].

h4. See also

* [[<|>_<|>]]
* [[horizontal pupils]]
* [[Tag Group:Eyes Tags]]

title: behemo_barisol
body:
A character of the [[Evillious Nendaiki]]. He is the "twin brother" of [[Levia barisol]], and is one of the protagonists of [[Barisol no Kodomo wa Hitorikko (vocaloid)|]].

One of the for pillar gods and the reason for the appearance of most of the [[Kagamine Len|Len]] characters through the series. He was a lonely boy who often was ostracized for his [[crossdressing]] habits and fascination for girl's stuffs.

Disciple of [[Held Yggdra]], he eventually researched about the body of the creatures and developed a method for creating humans.

[spoiler]Originally from the First Period, he had a connection to the developers behind the Second Period virtual world and had his original avatar, Levia, be a woman. After being contacted by Levia during the events of Barisol no Kodomo wa Hitorikko, he created another male avatar in the Second Period and claimed to be Levia's twin. His original body was responsible for bringing the refugees from the ruined Second Period out of the virtual world and into the ruined First Period upon which the Third Period was constructed. He is the true Master of the Heavenly Yard.

After the events of [[Kiseki no Yukue (vocaloid)|]], he reincarnated into the body of [[Elluka Chirclatia]] alongside Levia, remaining dormant inside her. After the Battle of Merrigod Plateau which resulted in the creation of [[Ma (evillious nendaiki)|]], he was blasted into the Hellish Yard, from which he travelled to the Heavenly Yard.

After reincarnating [[Allen Avadonia]] as [[Kokutan-douji]], he is ordered by [[Sickle (evillious nendaiki)|]] to bring the Irregular back to the Heavenly Yard, leading him to take up the identity of [[Tsukimoto Bufuko]] while in Jakoku.[/spoiler]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: irina_clockworker
body:
A main character and major antagonist from the [[Evillious Nendaiki]]. Portrayed by [[Nekomura Iroha]].

[spoiler]Her original identity was [[Maria Moonlit]], the puppet queen of Levianta. Her soul would then be moved into the body of a ghoul child (a type of artificial human) by [[Seth Twiright]].[/spoiler]

A Leviant citizen and the younger adoptive sister of [[Kiril Clockworker]]. She was a powerful witch and a major candidate in the [i]'MA' Project[/i]. [spoiler]During the project she killed the other 3 candidates, including her future sister-in-law, [[Elluka Chirclatia]].[/spoiler]

After almost dying during the Levianta's Catastrophe, her soul was transplanted into a mechanical stuffed red [[cat]] by [[Seth Twiright]] for save her life and from then she dedicated to wreack havoc and spread malice upon the world, while assuming different identities trough the ages, including [[I.R. (venomania-kou no kyouki)|]], [[AB-CIR]], [[Abyss I.R.]], and [[Julia Abelard]].

[spoiler]She later becomes one of the three souls fused together to create [[Ma (evillious nendaiki)|]], along with [[Levia barisol]] and [[Eve Moonlit]]. She would then be expelled into the [[Clockworker's Doll]], taking on the identity of [[Houtei no Nushi]].[/spoiler]

She's one of the main characters of [[Ma Survival (vocaloid)|]] and the focus of [[Dokoka de Kiita Uta (vocaloid)|]].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]
other_names: イリーナ=クロックワーカー

title: elluka_clockworker
body:
A main character from the [[Evillious Nendaiki]]. Portrayed by [[Megurine Luka]].

After the destruction of her country as a result of her disastrous resurrection granting her immortality, [[Elluka Chirclatia]] took the surname of her [[Kiril Clockworker|fiance]]. At the request of her old friend, the deity [[Held Yggdra|Held]], she took the mission of gathering the [[Vessel of Sin|vessels of sin]] in an attempt to prevent the danger they posed to the world and as a way to cope with her pointless eternal life.

She later takes on [[Michaela (evillious nendaiki)|]] and [[Gumillia]] as apprentices.

[spoiler]Actually a reincarnation of [[Levia barisol]], using the body and identity of the deceased Elluka Chirclatia.[/spoiler]

She's the main character of [[Chrono Story (vocaloid)|]] and [[Ano Hashi ni Chikatte (Vocaloid)|]].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]
other_names: エルルカ=クロックワーカー

title: ma_(evillious_nendaiki)
body:
Character from the [[Evillious Nendaiki]] and [spoiler]final antagonist of the series[/spoiler]. Her name is pronounced as the two individual letters, "em ay" (エムエー). Portrayed by [[Megurine Luka]], but generally shouldn't be tagged as such due to the different character designs.

A powerful sorceress and penwoman, apparently from Jakoku. Close friend and mistress of [[Gallerian Marlon]]. [[Chaban Capriccio (vocaloid)|]] states that her true name is [[Sudou Kayo|Kayo Sudou]].

[spoiler]An existence born from the soul fusion of [[Levia barisol]] ([[Elluka Clockworker]]), [[Irina Clockworker]] and [[Eve Moonlit]] after the Battle of Merrigod. With the only common thread between the three women being their candidacy for [[Ma Keikaku (vocaloid)|]] during [[Genzai Monogatari]], she chose to name herself Ma.

Lacking a soul of her own, she manipulated several people, including [[Sudou Kayo]] and Gallerian, to gather the [[vessel of sin|vessels of sin]], so she could fulfill her wish of became whole as a "pure being". She also attempted to expel the souls of the three women from her body as part of this, with her experiments on [[Lilith Baldured]] ending in failure due to her already being [[Riliane Lucifen d'Autriche|the reincarnation of an irregular]]. She would later have a child with [[Gandalf Marlon]] in a second attempt, but this was likewise a failure due to the child [[Gallerian Marlon|Gallerian]] being a boy. She later successfully expelled the soul of [[Levia barisol]] from her body through the birth of [[Nemesis Sudou]], conceived through an [[incest]]uous encounter with Gallerian. She would then place [[Irina Clockworker]] by placing her into the [[Clockworker's Doll]], convincing Gallerian (and [[Houtei no Nushi|the doll herself]]) that she was his daughter [[Michelle Marlon|Michelle]]. She was only able to expel [[Eve Moonlit]] at the end of the world with the birth of [[Eve (master of the heavenly yard)|]] from the [[black box (evillious nendaiki)|]] inside the Clockworker's Doll.[/spoiler]

She is one of the singers in [[Chaban Capriccio (vocaloid)|]].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: clockworker's_doll
body:
The Vessel of the Sloth in the [[Evillious Nendaiki]] universe.

A clockwork doll created by [[Irina Clockworker]] as [[I.R. (venomania-kou no kyouki)|]] during the events of [[Venomania Kou no Kyouki (vocaloid)|]] that resembles [[Eve Moonlit]], the Original Sinner. Eventually acquires a new consciousness and awakens as [[Houtei no Nushi]].

[spoiler]It was designed to contain the demon of sloth [[Eve Moonlit]] after Irina recognized it as residing inside [[Mikulia Greeonio]]. Once the demon moved into the doll, it would use its hypnosis several times to impersonate the identity of several woman, including [[Mikulia Calgaround]], [[Platonic (akujiki musume conchita)|]], and [[Margarita Blankenheim]].

During the Duel of Merrigod Plateau, Eve's soul fused with Irina Clockworker's and [[Levia barisol]]'s to create [[Ma (evillious nendaiki)|]], leaving the doll empty. After [[Michelle Marlon]]'s death, Ma took advantage of the situation to expel Irina's soul into the doll and convince [[Gallerian Marlon]] that the soul belongs to Michelle, leading [[Houtei no Nushi|her to believe she is as well]].

As a result of a series of body swaps during [[master of the heavenly yard (vocaloid)|]], [[Nemesis Sudou]]/[[Levia barisol]] ends up inside the doll.[/spoiler]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]
other_names: クロックワーカーズ・ドール

title: levia_barisol
body:
A recurring character of the [[Evillious Nendaiki]]. She is the "twin sister" of [[Behemo barisol]], and is one of the protagonists of [[Barisol no Kodomo wa Hitorikko (vocaloid)|]]. [spoiler]Behemo's original avatar in the Second Period.[/spoiler]

One of the four pillar gods and the reason for the appearance of most of the [[Kagamine Rin|Rin]] characters through the series. She was supposed to be the overseer of the Hellish Yard until a certain incident.

A brilliant scientist, she researched about the heart, the mind and soul of humans in an attempt to stop the spread of the "[i]Malice[/i]" and avoid the destruction of her world.

[spoiler]After the events of [[Kiseki no Yukue (vocaloid)|]], she is reincarnated (alongside a dormant Behemo) into the body of [[Elluka Chirclatia]], taking on the identity of [[Elluka Clockworker]]. She later becomes one of the three souls fused together to create [[Ma (evillious nendaiki)|]] alongside [[Irina Clockworker]] and [[Eve Moonlit]], before being expelled by reincarnating into [[Nemesis Sudou]].[/spoiler]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]
other_names: レヴィア=バリーゾール

title: kokutan-douji
body:
A character from [[Enbizaka no Shitateya (vocaloid)|]] featured in [[Nozarashi no Kubi Onigashima nite (vocaloid)|Nozarashi no Kubi, Onigashima nite]]. He is portrayed by [[Kagamine Len]] and is a reference to Momotarou.

A boy born from a black-wooded tree who went on a journey to find his true mother after being instructed to do so by a [[mermaid]]. He is accompanied by [[Saruteito]] and [[Inukichi (enbizaka no shitateya)|]] on his travels, eventually arriving in Enbizaka and boarding with [[Sudou Kayo]] while trying to determine the culprit behind a series of recent murders. Once Sudou Kayo is revealed to be said culprit, he is the one who ends up executing her via [[decapitation]].

[spoiler]A reincarnation of [[Allen Avadonia]], who was sent to Jakoku by [[Behemo barisol]] in an attempt for him to meet [[Riliane Lucifen d'Autriche]]'s reincarnation [[Miroku Rin]]. The two failed to meet because Rin left town when Kokutan was in Enbizaka and was murdered shortly after her return.

After utilizing [[Grim the End]] in a [[katana]] form to execute Kayo, he returned to the Heavenly Yard alongside Behemo and [[Octo Kagura]].[/spoiler]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: the_rain_woman
body:
A painting created in 1996 by Ukrainian artist Svetlana Telets. It features the portrait of a woman standing in the rain, who has distorted and elongated features, dresses all in black, and wears a large, wide-brimmed hat. It is known for its dubious creation process and being allegedly “haunted”.

The painting inspired a trend on Xiaohongshu to cosplay as the titular woman, giving it recognition in China.

title: friedrich_der_grosse_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the German battleship [i]Friedrich der Große[/i], as part of a collaboration with [i][[World of Warships]][/i]. Character design by [[Enka (bcat)]], voiced by [[Nabatame Hitomi]]. 

She is portrayed as a [[mature female|mature woman]] with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] [[hair over one eye|covering her right eye]], [[red horns|red]] [[mechanical horns]], [[yellow eyes]], and [[large breasts]]; who fancies herself an orchestra conductor. She sees the Commander and others as children, gently chiding them and being generally caring, unlike [[Roon (azur lane)|]]. 

Her default outfit consists of a [[double-breasted]] [[black dress]], [[detached sleeves]], [[red gloves]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of two animalistic hull pieces with all four of her 406 mm twin gun mounts. 

h4. Skins

* !post #3480690: Default
* !post #3975261: [[friedrich der grosse (zeremonie of the cradle) (azur lane)|Zeremonie of The Cradle]]
* !post #3779142: [[friedrich der grosse (dark raiments of gagaku) (azur lane)|Dark Raiments of Gagaku]]
* !post #8052266: [[friedrich der grosse (one summer night's intimacy) (azur lane)|One Summer Night's Intimacy]]

h4. History

The H-class proposals were a series of battleship designs meant to succeed [[Bismarck (azur lane)|]] and significantly improve the [i]Kriegsmarine's[/i] fighting capacity against the Royal Navy and [i]Marine Nationale[/i]. Wartime materials shortages and the infrequent operations of [i]Kriegsmarine[/i] following the sinking of [i]Bismarck[/i] prevented further development of the designs.
The ships were also left unnamed, with [[Ulrich von Hutten (Azur Lane)|]] being the closest to an actual name as attested by documented unofficial talks in the German Naval High Command. 

h4. Alternative verisions

* !post #7648887: [[little friedrich (azur lane)|Little Friedrich]]

h4. See also
* [[Ulrich von Hutten (Azur Lane)|]], the only one of the H-39s that ever received some gesture of naming.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: H-class":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/H-class_battleship_proposals]

title: albert_heinrich
body: One of the protagonists of the series [[Cyborg 009]], the silver-haired Albert and his wife Hilda were shot while trying to flee Communist East Germany. The would-be escapee was transformed by the Black Ghost organization into Cyborg 004, a walking arsenal. His legs conceal [[rocket launcher|rocket launchers]], his right hand has a [[machine gun]] in each finger, and his left is razor-edged.

title: satonaka_chie
body:
A [[Persona 4]] character.

An upbeat girl with [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] who usually wears a [[green jacket|green]] [[track jacket|athletic jacket]] decorated with buttons. Her weapon is a pair of greaves. She has an obsession with Kung fu, and even uses them in battle, similar to Lisa Silverman of Persona 2. Most of the time, she is friendly, cheerful, and energetic, but she has a short temper, especially with Yousuke. Chie, Yukiko, and Rise are unskilled at cooking, often providing the main cast with unpalatable to terribly awful dishes through the course of the story. Yousuke refers to their horrible cooking as "Mystery Food X."

Her Persona is [[Tomoe (Persona 4)|]] of The Chariot Arcanum, a muscular female figure wearing a yellow outfit reminiscent of Bruce Lee's famous tracksuit, wielding a double bladed naginata. Tomoe is shown to use both physical and low-level ice spells. Tomoe evolves into [[Suzuka Gongen]] after maxing out her Social Link, the one for The Chariot Arcana.

She is also one of the female characters whom the protagonist can have a romantic relationship with.

Voiced by: [[Horie Yui]] (Japanese), Tracey Rooney (English, PS2 release), [[Erin Fitzgerald]] (English, [[Persona 4 The Golden|Golden]] onward).

h4. Appearance
* !post #397704: Default
* !post #1936623: [[Persona 4: Dancing All Night]]

title: vegetative_state
body:
A physical and mental state where the patient is completely catatonic, lacking any movement or reaction to the environment. It is caused by either severe head trauma, an extended lack of oxygen to the brain, or a very serious mental disease.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Vegetative state":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vegetative_state]

title: mohg_lord_of_blood
body:
[b]Mohg, Lord of Blood[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]].

[spoiler]Mohg is the [[twins|twin]] [[brothers|brother]] of [[margit the fell omen|Morgott]] and one of the children of [[godfrey first elden lord|Godfrey]] and [[queen marika the eternal|Marika]]. While under the influence of another, Mohg spirited [[Miquella (elden ring)|]] away to become his consort.[/spoiler]

title: textless_version
body:
An alternate version of an image without text. Generally applies to explicit images that remove the dialogue after the illustration is complete, or to [[cover|covers]] that don't have the title or any [[content rating]] information.

This tag is for text-free alternate versions released by the original artist. Use [[detexted]] for images that have had their text removed by a [[third-party edit]].

h4. See also

* [[cover image]]
* [[detexted]]
* [[variant set]]
** [[large variant set]]

title: mystic_eyes_of_death_perception
body:
A type of [[Mystic Eyes]] from [[Tsukihime]] and [[Melty Blood]] that are considered to be such a rarity that they are thought not to exist at all. Under the Noble Colors System, they are designated as Rainbow, the highest level, and are considered Divine Spirit class Mystic Eyes. The eye granted the user an ability to see the "Lines of Death" on a living being, and allowed them to "cut" it to instantly kill anyone.

They are possessed by [[Ryougi Shiki]] and [[Tohno Shiki]]. Also [[Michael Roa Valdamjong]] in the body of [[Tohno Shiki (2)]] displays a similar ability.

h4. Examples
* !post #1512285: Mystic Eye of Death in use
* !post #7048424: Lines of Death, first-person view

h4. External links
* "Type-Moon Wiki: Mystic Eyes of Death Perception":https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Mystic_Eyes_of_Death_Perception

title: pack_noodles
body:
A ready-to-eat food composed of instant [[noodles]], typically [[instant ramen|ramen]] noodles, sold with [[packet]]s that have flavoring powder, seasoning oil, etc., contained in a plastic pack, or bag for larger noodles or for housing multiple smaller packs. Most require no cooking, so you just add to a bowl, add hot water, and cover and wait for three minutes before eating, but others may require stovetop cooking for three minutes.

Because the noodles are already cooked, the [[instant noodle block]] can be eaten directly from the pack to comedic results.

h4. See also

* [[cup ramen]]
* [[instant ramen]]
* [[instant udon]]
* [[instant soba]]
